loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of KES 62,525 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en:
Yalchin is a 40-year-old refugee. He is married, has two daughters and the family lives in an IDP (internally displaced person) settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates the children. Yalchin is a farmer; he raises seasonal fruits (apples, pears, cherries and etc.) and sells them at local bazaar. He has a good experience because has been working in this area for 13 years. His monthly income is 200 AZN.

Yalchin’s grocery is very popular at the bazaar because his fruits are always fresh and tasty. People have a high demand for fresh fruits because of their use for health. People prepare apple pies, cherry jams for tea and pear juice.

Yalchin needs to increase his income because his monthly salary is too low to cover the family’s demands.  He wants to provide his daughters with a good education and a bright future and he is ready to do everything for them. He applied for 1,100 AZN in order to buy and raise new sorts of seasonal fruit trees. He hopes that this will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy and raise new sorts of seasonal fruit trees.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells dry fish at the market on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 2 years. Aisha has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 to buy more baskets of smoked fish. Her major challenge includes thieves and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of smoked fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, drinks, breads and toothpastes in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with one child who is an adult. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanamisi operated a food-making business, making constables like, beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase juice flavors for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase juice flavors for her business.

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.ru:
Юрий - предприниматель из города Виноградово, расположенного в западной части Украины. Раньше он занимался транспортными перевозками, но затем сменил направление бизнеса на торговлю одеждой. Юрий по-преждему использует свой микроавтобус в бизнесе - ездит за товаром.

Юрий собирается купить новую партию весеннего товара в Венгрии. Он хочет поехать один раз и сделать большую закупку. Таким образом он съэкономит на транспортных расходах, а значит возрастет и его прибыль. Юрий просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 25,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Yuriy is a entrepreneur from the city of Vinogradovo, located in the Western part of Ukraine. In the past, he worked in freight transportation but then he changed his business field to selling clothing. Previously, he used his minibus to transport his merchandise in his new business.

Yuriy is planning to buy a new lot of Spring merchandise from Hungary. He wants to go one time and make a large purchase. In that way, he will be able to save on transportation expenses and thus grow his profits. Yuriy is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 UAH.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira and her family live in the Tavush region in a beautiful village of Kiranc. This village is one of the frontier villages in this region and life here, as Naira says, is always full of fear and danger. She says that very often shots are heard along their village border, but the people over the years have somehow gotten used to these sounds and they have become very careful and prudent in their everyday life and actions. Naira’s family is one of those many families that have not thought of leaving their village because of everyday danger. They have established a nice farm and do everything to make it bigger and richer. In their farm, they have two cows, a calf and fifteen chickens. They also have a plot of land on which they raise greens, tomato and beans. The sale of farm products is the main source of income for their family. Naira’s husband, son and daughter are all engaged in farming activities. Naira simultaneously works at the school as a teacher and her husband from time to time goes to Russian Federation for works abroad. Naira would like to repair her cattle barn which is in a very poor condition. She needs this loan to rebuild the barn thoroughly while she also wants to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to repair & rebuild her cattle barn thoroughly, which is in a very poor condition as well as to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Mari Cruz

texts.es: Mari Cruz es originaria  del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, actualmente tiene 39 años y desde hace mas de 13 años es propietaria de un restaurante y tortillería, lo cual es su fuente de ingresos y la base para obtener ingresos y cumplir así con sus responsabilidades. Tiene 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando; doña Mari Cruz junto a su esposo desean que sus hijos se lleguen a graduar y tener una profesión. Necesita comprar maíz y leña para su tortillería y por ello solicita el crédito y desde ya agradece a Kiva y Fape que le brindan su ayuda.
texts.en: Mari Cruz is a native of the San Martin Jilotepeque area. She is 39 years old and for more than 13 years has been the owner of a restaurant and tortilla shop. These are her sources of money so that she can fulfill her financial obligations. Her 4 children are all studying. Mari Cruz together with her husband hope that they graduate and have a profession. She needs to buy corn and wood for her tortillas and so she is requesting a loan . She is grateful to Kiva and Fape for their support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make meals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, fish, onions, etc. in bulk in order to be able to cook a larger quantity of rice with sauce for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members such as her mother. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis, working seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to sell on a whole sale basis. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child and her child goes to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells secondhand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy a bale of secondhand clothes. 

Her major challenge includes transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling both used and first-hand clothes and also sell on wholesale basis. She lives in rented house where the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent, and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Mwanamaka

texts.en: Mwanamaka is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past twenty years, she has operated her own rental house business. She faces a major challenge of maintenance on her rental houses. With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase building materials for her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for her rental houses.

loans.name: Protazio

texts.en:
Protazio is a male aged 64 years. He is married with four children plus two dependent grandchildren. He deals in bark cloth and he works 7 days in a week and 10 hours a day.

He has also been doing agriculture since 1972 from which he earns an extra living. He was motivated to join the bark cloth business because it was a family business and his area of expertise. He sells his bark cloth products to fellow traders and local people around a nearby trading centre and surrounding villages and trading centers.

He hopes to use the loan to boost his bark cloth business and agriculture which will in turn improve his incomes and also expand his business. He faces a challenge of stiff completion and limited capital. He is described as an honest and hard working man.

He asks lenders to always give clients the amount of money they apply for so as to enable them to operate their businesses smoothly.

loans.use: To buy bark cloth to trade and also to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Raees

texts.en:
Raees is an 18-year-old married lady and is running a small general store in her community with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy packs of grains, sugar, rice and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 33-year-old married woman. She has six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has had a business doing carpet manufacturing for the past two years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and profits.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Вот уже 8 лет, как Валентина имеет  свой бизнес. Она продает продукты питания в четырех селах, расположенных 20-40 километров от Никополя. У нее работает 5 человек и есть огромное количество постоянных покупателей. Валентина много работает, чтобы обеспечить покупателей в своих магазинах свежими товарами. 

Недавно в одном из магазинов Валентины произошла кража товара. И хотя воров так и не нашли (и товар не вернули) Валентина не отчаилась. Она продолжила упорно работать и вывела этот магазин на прежний уровень товарооборота.

Еще один удар постиг Валентину несколько лет назад. Умер один из двух ее сыновей. Он пришел домой после спотривной тренировки и у него случился сердечный приступ. Валентине до сих пор тяжело принять то, что случилось. Впрочем, сосредотачиваясь на работе, Валентина легче переносит утрату.

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки товара и улучшения торговых условий в своих магазинах. Она намерена продолжать работать  дальше, развивать свой бизнес, обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en:
For 8 years already, Valentina has had her own business. She sells groceries in four villages located 20 to 40 kilometers from Nikopol. She has 5 people working for her and she has a huge amount of loyal customers. Valentina works a lot to provide her store customers with fresh goods.

Not too long ago, there was a theft of goods from one of Valentina's stores. And although the robbers were never found (and the goods were not returned), Valentina did not despair. She continued to work hard and brought this store back to its previous level of sales turnover.

Several years ago, Valentina was hit.by another blow. One of her two sons died. He came home after a sports practice and had a heart attack. To this day, it is difficult for Valentina to accept what happened. Admittedly, by concentrating on work, it has been easier for Valentina to endure this loss.

Valentina is requesting a loan to buy goods and improve the selling environment in her stores. She is determined to continue to work longer, develop her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy goods and improve the selling environment in her stores.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulchehra was born in 1983. She is a hardworking woman. Gulchehra is divorced and does not have any children. She lives with her parents. She works in a factory. She is also a sewer. Gulchehra sews national women dresses at night. She works hard to earn a living. Gulchehra is the main breadwinner  of her family. She is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. Her parents have not had the opportunity to repair the house. Gulchehra is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, paints etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paints etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
Johnbosco a single, hardworking man who is 28 years old and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is businessman, having a retail shop. He earns additional income from farming. 

He started the business in 2009, in a rural area, so as to earn a living. He has hopes of having a comfortable home, although he faces a challenge of low capital in the business.

Johnbosco is acquiring a loan to buy more sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and soap for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Angeline appreciates her previous Kiva loan that helped improve her living standards. She is now requesting for a loan of ksh.40,000 to purchase body lotions, bales of clothes and hair weaves for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase body lotions, bales of clothes and hair weaves for resale

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees had a difficult time due to her husband’s business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Eight years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her 5th loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. It will allow her to stitch more dresses on time.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 39-years-old married woman. She has three children. She has run a beauty parlor business for the past five years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By doing her best in providing services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor. As a result of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her seventh loan cycle. She needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers again and again.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 33, is a married woman. She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out on the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three cows and three buffaloes, which she uses to get milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Manzooran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts through the years. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Beenish

texts.en:
Beenish is a 29-year-old married woman. For about 8 years she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of thread in different colours and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for the embellishments. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colours and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar, age 41, is a married woman. She is in business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to afford her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan she will definitely expand her business and income level. 

She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 27 years old and he lives with his parents, sister and brother in the village of Achajur in Tavush region. Samvel has a specialty in economics, but he has never worked in his area of specialty, since he was engaged in farming and agriculture with his father when he was very young. Samvel and his father also decided to work in framing and go to the Russian Federation to do various construction jobs. Samvel’s sister has her own small business working from home: she takes orders to make cakes and other baked goods. So this large family works very hard and each family member tries to do his and her best in order to provide each other with good living conditions.  

On his farm, Samvel has a cow, a pig, three piglets and 20 chickens. From his large vineyard, Samvel gathers the best kinds of grapes for black muskat, a wine that is very popular around the world, especially among wine lovers. He also sells vegetables and fruit from his garden, such as cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, potatoes, persimmons, pears, figs, etc.

Samvel wants to do some repairs in his vineyard and he also needs to buy fodder for his farm cattle. That is why he asks for a loan from Kiva lenders and hopes to receive it and to realize his plans.

loans.use: to do some repairs in his vineyard and to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 54 years old. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her in meeting the demands of her customers on time. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar junto a sus hijos, como toda madre responsable por dar a sus hijos lo necesario para una vida digna y apoyar en los gastos familiar se dedica a tender su negocio en el mercado de venta de comida, esté oficio lo aprendió siendo empleada de cocina, actualmente tiene 10 años de hacerlo independiente.
Está solicitando capital para comprar carnes, pastas, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, aceite, etc., lo que le permitirá elaborar diferentes platillos para el gusto de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía.
Martha sueña con tener un negocio más reconocido que le de los recursos económicos para cancelar la deuda adquirida y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Martha is a single mother who lives in the family house with her children. Like any responsible mother she does everything possible to provide her children with all they need and a dignified life. She supports the household expenses taking care of her business making meals in the market. She learned this work as an employee in a kitchen and has been doing this business for 10 years now. 

Martha is requesting a loan to buy meat, pasta, vegetables, spices, drinks, oil, etc. which will allow her to make the different dishes for the enjoyment of her customers. She hopes to increase her sales and improve her finances. Martha dreams of having a well recognized business which provides her with the financial resources to pay off her loan and improve the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy meat, pasta, vegetables, spices, drinks, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 44 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Gemma has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 22 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits at the market on retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. 

She has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, cassava and pineapples. Her major challenges include seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and also sale on whole sale basis. She lives in rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, cassava and pineapples.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера начинала торговать на центральном рынке на торговой точке которая раннее принадлежала отцу, потом отец перестал заниматься бизнесом по состоянию здоровья и со временем она расширила бизнес и на данный момент имеет 3 торговых точки. На одной Вера работает сама, на двух других работают продавцы. Все торговые точки расположены на в местах, где присутствует хорошая проходимость людей. Хорошие цены также привлекают покупателей. 

Вера просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки товара. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент на всех своих торговых точках, т.к. это является залогом успеха в данной бизнесе, ведь чем больше выбор, тем больше покупателей.

Вера разведена. Она живет с сыном в своей квартире. Сын учится в колледже.
texts.en:
Vera began to sell merchandise at a stall in the central market which used to belong to her father. Her father stopped his sales business for medical reasons and Vera eventually decided to take up and expand this business. She currently has three retail stalls. Vera works at one of them herself, and salespeople work at the two other stalls. All of the stalls are located in places which are high traffic areas for customers.

Vera is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. She wants to increase her assortment of goods at her stalls, as this is a recipe for success in this business : The more choice, the more customers.

Vera is divorced. She lives with her son in an apartment. Her sons attends college.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her merchandise.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dominga is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Dominga has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Dominga requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Dominga has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Dominga would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 31 years old, a married lady and the mother of three children. She is running a small general store in the corner of her house to meet their household expenditures as her husband is employed with a low salary income. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en:
Yosam is a married man aged 40 years with one child who is attending school near his home. He is also taking care of his mother who is too old to live alone. He lives in a rural setting with his family and deals in cattle business and also farming as a side business and started his business in 2000.

He works all the seven days of the week and 12 hours per day. He started his business due to the experience he had in running such a business and because of the quick and high profits one can get from such a business. 

He has acquired this loan to fatten his cows before trading them. His clients are from different towns. His future hope is to have 5000 cows to trade every 6 months and the challenge he faces is the unpredictable weather conditions like too much sunshine that dries all the pastures leaving his cows with no grass to feed on. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to fatten his cattle.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jocelyn has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Ma. Jocelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. Ma. Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. With her husband, she has been doing agricultural work for many years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, packs of insecticides and pesticides, Haleema applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia works hard to support her family. Lucrecia is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lucrecia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Lucrecia has been in this business for 25 years now.

Lucrecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is aged 53. She has been running a business of foodstuffs and has spent more than fifteen years doing this. 

She would like to use the loan to buy more sorghum, beans and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Gerlyn

texts.en:
Gerlyn is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gerlyn is 43 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Gerlyn has a business buying and selling rubber strips in the Philippines. Gerlyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like rubber for her business.

Gerlyn has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Gerlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like rubber for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Gina is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 51, is a married woman. Her business is animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting in the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet their household expenses. 

Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at their store. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding their business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a female aged 57 years and has two children. She has a retail shop as her business. She works seven days a week and 12 hours a day. She started business in 1987 and it is located in Hoima.  

She started the business to take care of the family. She sells to people around Hoima and her hope is to boost her business. She faces a challenge of fluctuation in her business due to prices. 

She is acquiring a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Kyererezi Group

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 32-year-old man living in Kagadi, Uganda with three children aged 6, 4 and 2 years of which two attend school. He has been selling produce, farming, rearing animals and selling alcohol to increase his daily income. He hopes for business growth, education of children and income growth. 

Mustafa is requesting a loan to buy maize, coffee and alcohol to sell. He is a member of Kyererezi Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize, coffee and alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru: Любовь продает ритуальные товары на центральном рынке города. Она уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами и считает их выгодными для своего бизнеса. Год назад благодаря КИВА кредиту Любовь смогла изготовить венки для продажи и увеличить свой доход. Поэтому в этом году Любовь также хочет воспользоваться кредитом и взять сумму в три раза больше, чем в прошлый раз - 15,000 гривен. Такая сумма позволит Любви развить свой бизнес и в результате существенно увеличить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Lubov sells merchandise used for ceremonies at the city's central market. She has used KIVA loans before and considers them useful for her business. One year ago, thanks to a KIVA loan, Lubov was able to make wreathes for sale and increase her income. That is why this year Lubov also wants to take advantage of a loan and take out an amount three times bigger than the last time - 15,000 UAH. This amount will allow Lubov to develop her business and, as a result, fundamentally improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make artificial flower arrangements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cow’s skin for her business.

loans.name: Mary Aianne

texts.en:
Mary Aianne, a 37-year-old married mother of three children who are currently in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years she has operated a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Aianne has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вера – вдова, детей воспитывает сама. Она имеет свой бизнес - продает пряжу,нитки, биссер, вышивку. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту она смогла получить дополнительную прибыль и оплатить учебу детей. В этот раз Вера хочет воспользоваться кредитом для улучшения своих жилищныых условий. Кредит в 8,000 гривен позволит Вере сделать ремонт в кухне - положить новый пол, покрасить стены, поменять мойку и газовую печь. Бизнес Веры идет хорошо, поэтому Вера уверена, что с выплатами не будет проблем. Мечта Веры - сделать ремонт во всем доме.
texts.en: Vera is a widow. She raised her children by herself. She has her own business selling yarn, thread, beads and needlework. Thanks to her previous KIVA loan, she was able to receive additional profits and pay for her children's education. This time, Vera hopes to take advantage of a loan to improve her living conditions. Vera plans to use a loan of 8,000 UAH to repair her kitchen - to put in a new floor, paint the walls, and change out her dishwasher and gas oven. Vera's business is going well, which is why Vera is sure that paying back the loan will not be a problem. Vera's dream is to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Philine

texts.en:
Philine is 36 years old and married with two children.

Philine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Philine has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Philine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Radiola

texts.en:
Radiola works hard to support her family. She is married and has a handicraft business in the Philippines.

Radiola requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like shells, wire, etc. for her business.

Radiola has been in this business for eight years now.

Radiola would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like shells and wire for her business

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a 25-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. Ritchel is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ritchel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish for resale.

Ritchel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish for resale.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is 20 years old and, despite his young age, is very worried and he greatly wants to improve his family’s living conditions. Gevorg lives in the frontier village of Kirants in the Tavush region. At this moment, Gevorg and his sister are students at the paid division of Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, but it does not keep them from being engaged in farming with their parents. Gevorg’s smallest sister is school-aged. Gevorg says that farming is a very familiar and pleasant occupation for him since he has done it since he was just six years old. On his farm, Gevorg breeds 4 cows, 7 calves and 10 chickens. He also has 3 beehives that give a little honey that is very tasty and pure. His mother sells milk and meat from the farm. Until now, Gevorg kept his cattle at a rented barn, but now he decided to ask for a loan and build a barn of his own near their house. He also wants to buy animal fodder. This will be a great savings for his family since the rented barn was very expansive for their family’s acute finances.

loans.use: to build a barn and buy animal fodder

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is 21 years old. He lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region with his parents and school-aged sister. Khachik’s father is now in the Russian Federation and from there he works, transferring money to his family. Khachik himself is a contractual serviceman and at the same time he is a student of Crisis Management Academy of Vanadzor branch in the paid division. Khachik’s salary is very small; together with his father’s support from abroad, the money hardly covers their needs. Thus, his tuition fee is a great problem for his family.

He asks a loan of 90,000 AMD to pay his tuition fee for the second semester. It will be of great help for Khachik’s family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Rozalina

texts.en:
Rozalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rozalina has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Rozalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell to her customers in her buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business.

Julinda has been in this business for three years. Julinda earns more income from general store.

Julinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 43 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

Teresa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like fabric softener, laundry soap, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, bread, etc., for resale. Teresa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. 

Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like fabric softener, laundry soap, canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, bread, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been farming corn for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support her family. Marieta is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marieta requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to resell.

Marieta has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marieta would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and has three children. Marilyn is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is 46 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Manvel's specialty is being a builder and for over 21 years he has worked in this sphere. He repairs houses and flats, shops and offices and he works professionally, quickly and with high quality. His work is very hard and sometimes he goes home very late at night, but it gives him an opportunity to pay for his two daughters’ education (both of them are students) and cover other needs of his family.
 
Manvel is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy some new tools and equipment for his construction work, which will make his work easier and faster.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is 55 years old and she lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Bela is married and she has two daughters and one son. All of them are married and they live with their families. Bela’s husband transfers cargo around their region. 

For many years, Bela worked as a saleswoman. Now she has her own small shop, where she sells different household items, food and soft drinks. She says that the number of her loyal customers is so much that only through their visit at the end of the month does she manage to have a good profit.

Now she needs a loan, which she will use for the purchase of different products for her store, which will increase the assortment of items offered, as well as increase the number of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase different products for her store.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives with his family in Ijevan city in Tavush region. He is 33 years old. Karen is married and has two school-aged daughters. It has already been 20 years since Karen has been running his fruit-vegetable trading business. His parents help him very much. Since once a week, on his own car, Karen drives to Yerevan and he brings some part of fruits from there; his parents stay for him. 

His stall is more colorful, nicer, and richer among the other stalls in the city wholesale market. He sells different sorts of apples, oranges, grapes, lemons, bananas, mandarins, tomatoes, green potatoes, cucumbers, onions, etc. He arranges all these products so cutely and nicely that his stall attracts many customers during the day.

Now Karen asks for a loan, since he wants to buy a lot of vegetables and some new assortment of fruits for his stall that he never sold before.

loans.use: to buy a lot of vegetables and a new assortment of fruits for his stall.

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is a farmer living in the rich highland area of Litein, an area known for good quality tea production. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has been farming for 10 years with her primary income sources being milk and tea. Chelangat enjoys keeping dairy cows, while her biggest challenge is lack of funds.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their processing of client loans is faster and the loans are at a low interest rate. During the training, she learnt that mfis (micro-finance institutions) help improve the lives of small scale farmers. This loan will enable her to construct a dairy unit extension and this will ensure a good environment for milk production. This will increase her income and thus help in paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit extension.

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es: Don Leónidas es un señor trabajador quien en la actualidad se desempeña como taxista recorriendo las calles todo el día para ganarse el peso de cada día, padre de siete hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad. Solicita el crédito para construir el porche de su casa, comprando los materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques. Leónidas como planes futuros tiene ahorrar para poner un pequeño negocio y dejar de taxear ya que a su edad se vuelve más cansado su trabajo.
texts.en: Leónidas is a hard-working man who currently has a job as a taxi driver. He goes around the streets all day in order to earn a living. Leónidas is a father to seven children, all of whom are now adults. Leónidas is applying for a loan in order to build a porch on his house. With this loan he will buy building materials such as cement, iron, sand and bricks. Leónidas' future plans are to save up to start a small business. He wants to stop driving taxis as, given his age, Leónidas is feeling more tired after work.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron and bricks.

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.ru: Евгения замужем, у нее двое детей. Евгения торгует женской одеждой на центральном рынке. Она хорошо знает этот бизнес поэтому торговля идет хорошо. Евгения просит предоставить ей кредит в 12,000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара. Увеличив ассортимент, Евгения сможет привлечь больше покупателей, а значит и получить больший доход.
texts.en: Evgeniya is married and has two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market. She knows this business well, and so her sales are going strong. Evgeniya is applying for a loan in the amount of 12,000 UAH to buy seasonal merchandise. By increasing her stock selection, Evgeniya will be able to attract more customers, and thus earn a bigger income.

loans.use: to increase assortment of seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Bessy

texts.es:
La señora Bessy es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, en su negocio el cual es una Pulpería desde hace más de 4  años.
Doña Bessy la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de gran variedad de productos como frijoles, azúcar, manteca, arroz, café, agua, pan,  leche, jugos, etc. y así seguir realizando su negocio.
Doña Bessy con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Bessy espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para  que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Bessy is a very hard-working, humble and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. Bessy has been making  a living selling basic goods in her grocery store for over four years. Bessy runs the store out of a room in her house.

Bessy needs this loan in order to buy a great variety of products such beans, sugar, butter, rice, coffee, water, bread, milk, juices and more to continue with her business.

Bessy hopes that, with this loan, her sales will increase. She hopes that the loan will be of use to her as she does not currently have the products that her customers come looking for every day. With this loan, Bessy hopes to improve her and her family's quality of life with a higher income coming into her household.

Bessy hopes in the short term to expand her business and to be able to continue supporting her family so that they may have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, butter, rice, coffee, water, bread, milk, juices and more for her business.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Florencia is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Florencia has a general store business in the Philippines. Florencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items, such as salt, seasonings, coconut, spices, etc. to resell.

Florencia has been in this business for 18 years. Florencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as salt, seasonings, coconut, spices, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 27 years now. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Aurea works hard to support her family.

She has a sewing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets. Aurea is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Aurea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Bendicto

texts.en:
Bendicto is a married man, 54 years old, and he has 12 children, 7 of whom are attending schools in different areas. He lives in a rural setting with his family. He deals in produce trading and supplements his family income with farming, such as growing maize, bananas, coffee and beans. He started his business in 1984 in order to improve the family's standard of living and to educate his children. 

He describes himself as a hardworking man. He faces challenges of limited capital, drought and the price fluctuation of agricultural products. He says his clients are traders from neighboring villages. He hopes to continue to improve on his standard of living and to educate all his children.

He has acquired this loan so as to complete the roofing of his house since he anticipates rains soon.

loans.use: To roof his house.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 30 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherry has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Cherry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Cristita works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets and also from a general store. 

Cristita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and married with three children. With all three currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, biscuits, candies, etc. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 47 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling flowers.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Julita is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. Julita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is 36 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Leoncia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Leoncia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 37 years old and married with four children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Thelma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ada Beatriz

texts.es:
Ada, es casada, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, como una forma de tener más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a atender una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad y también tiene el servicio de un molino nixtamal, por el momento no presenta problemas.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, pan, bebidas, golosinas y fajas para el molino, le ayudara a tener a la disposición mercadería que sus clientes necesitan y dar un mejor servicio, espera mejorar su economía familiar,
Se anhelo es mantenerse trabajando para cumplir con sus compromisos familiares y sobre todo dar a  su hijo la oportunidad de superación académica.
texts.en:
Ada is married. She has a seven year old son. As a way of having more income to cover the household expenses she has a store offering staples and she also has a service grinding nixtamal (corn kernels which has been cooked and steeped in an alkaline solution and then washed), and as of now has had no problems.

She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of basic grains, bread, beverages, candy, and belts for the grinder. This will help her to have merchandise available that her customers need so she can offer better service. She hopes to improve her family finances. She is longing to continue working in order to pay the family commitments and above all to give her son the opportunity for academic success.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, beverages, candy, and belts for the grinder

loans.name: Delis Oralia

texts.es:
La  señora  Delis  es una persona  emprendedora,  honesta, responsable   y seria, vive  con su familia  en  una comunidad  al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  ropa y baleadas  lo cual  hace desde hace más de 4  años en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos a  esta.
Doña Delis dicha  actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos, el préstamo lo necesita  para  la compra de ropa  pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, etc.  Con el préstamo  espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña Delis espera que a un corto plazo su negocio siga creciendo y  convirtiéndose   en  el  más conocido de su barrio y seguir  apoyando a su familia e hijos.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del   2014
texts.en:
Delis is an enterprising woman. She is honest, responsible and reliable. She lives with her family in a community in southern Honduras. Her business is buying and selling clothing and Honduran tortillas. She has been selling from her home and in nearby places.

This activity forms the major part of her income. She needs the loan to buy pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc. With the loan she hopes that her business sales will increase with more merchandise to offer her clients and to be able to cover the related necessities.

Delis hopes that within a short period of time her business continues growing and becomes the best known in her neighborhood so she can continue supporting her family and children.

Choluteca, Honduras, – February 2014

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dúo Chiarmira Group

texts.es:
Duo Chiarmira
Dúo formado por doña Francisca es originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque, Francisca tiene desde hace más de 25 años una tortillería lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a kiva esperando que la fundación le dé la ayuda que necesita. Solicita el crédito para la compra maiz por mayor y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Chiarmira Duo

This duo includes Francisca. She is from the area of San Martin Jilotepeque. For 25 years, Francisca she has had a tortilla business. She fights to give her family the best. This is the first loan she has applied for from Kiva. She hopes that the foundation will give her the help she needs. She is asking for the loan to buy corn wholesale and have more income.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale for making tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a beautiful woman with an amiable personality who loves to travel and explore the world. She is pictured with her mother standing on the right side. She belongs to a middle class family from Manipur, in the northeastern region of India. She always wanted to work in aviation, which she believes will make her dreams come true. 

She grew up facing financial problems as her father is the sole breadwinner of the family. Her mother is a housewife who is entirely dependent on her husband’s income. Her father is a full time employee working in the central government sector. He gets only 18,000 INR as a monthly salary, which is not sufficient to support her and her two younger siblings to pursue a career in any professional fields. However, this concern does not stop her from pursuing her dreams. 

“Many a times, it broke her heart thinking that she won’t be able to get the opportunity to pursue her dream career. She was fortunate to be selected among hundreds of aspiring candidates but financial issues have again become a great concern, which gave her mixed feeling of joy and sadness," says Jessica. 

She was introduced to Kiva loans by one of her friends. It was such a great relief when she learned about such an amazing organization that rendered financial help to the poor and helpless.  She will use her Kiva loan to pay for the cabin crew training fees that are mandatory for all the selected candidates. “The loan money will act as a bridge to lead her to a successful career,” says Jessica. She wishes to support her family and provide her siblings with a better education and opportunity to learn and be successful once she starts earning. She also wants to invest in helping others who need financial help like her to pursue a career.

 She wholeheartedly thanks and appreciates Kiva for being such a great help and a savior who provided her a platform to pursue her dream career.

loans.use: To pay the security deposit for cabin crew training

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila ella es casada y tiene 63 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de cabinas de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “LAS FLORES” communal bank, located in San Sebastian, part of the Cusco department and province.

Lucila is 63 years old, married, and has three children.  She works in her animal buying and selling business and raises Guinea pigs and chickens and then sells them at the various fairs.  She gets her children ahead through this business and her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the Guinea pigs and chickens.  She is asking for this loan to buy Guinea pigs, chickens, and feed.

The member whose picture is pasted onto the group picture took her picture later because of work commitments.

The rest of the members sell sandwiches, clothing, have grocery stores, and restaurants.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs, chickens, and feed.

loans.name: Eliseo De Jesus

texts.es: Eliseo tiene 33 años de edad y  habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad. Eliseo trabaja como auxiliar de albañilería y su deseo es convertirse en un buen albañil y así poder ayudar a su familia y brindar mejores condiciones. Eliseo solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la reparación de la pared del hogar. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder al cambio de las paredes lo antes posible.
texts.en: Eliseo is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his life companion and 5 year old daughter. Eliseo works as a masonry assistant and his desire is to become a good mason so he can support his family providing better conditions. Eliseo is asking for a loan through FUSAI because he wants to repair the wall of his house. With the amount requested he will buy  galvanized sheeting and wood in order to begin changing the walls as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood in order to repair the wall of his house.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Florites works hard to support her family. Florites is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Florites requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Florites has been in this business for 7 years now.

Florites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jezabel

texts.en:
Jezabel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jezabel is 53 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jezabel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jezabel requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jezabel has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Jezabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 55 years old and married with five children. 

Lilian is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilian requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilian has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been in this business for 5 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 50 years old and married with three children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marissa has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling purified drinking water.

Marissa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and do the clearing for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 56 years old and married with four children. Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Lucena has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Lucena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Meet Philip, a farmer living in Litein area of South Rift Kenya with his wife and 4 children who are between the ages of 25 and 1 year. He loves farming since it has given him a broad network. He has been involved in farming for 12 years. His income sources are milk and crops.

Philip chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their interest rates are low and affordable for the low income earner. This loan will enable him to construct a greenhouse so that he will be able to plant more crops and get more income. This income will enable him to pay for his children's school fees and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Erinayo

texts.en:
Erinayo is a married man, aged 41 years, living with his family in a rural area. He has 3 children all of whom attend school. He also pays the tuition for 2 of his nephews for a secondary school near his home. 

Erinayo is in the agricultural business where he grows coffee, beans, maize and bananas. He also engages in produce trading as a side business.  He started this business in 2007. He works 6 days in a week and 8 hours per day. He started this business to increase the family's income and he is acquiring this loan to stock more produce and to also improve on the fertility of his gardens. His clients are traders from cities and the surrounding villages.

Erinayo's future hope is to expand his business. The challenge he faces is too much drought which affects productivity. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man who encourages lenders to continue helping business people to enable them to expand their businesses and to develop their communities.

loans.use: to buy produce.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Biakoye and they are composed of six members for this loan. All the members of the group are women. Four are married with three children on the average under their care. They are natives of Teshie-Accra which is part of the coastal part of the country. They are all hard-working and responsible individuals. Today they strive from day-to-day to provide their children a better future.

The featured borrower is Margaret who was born in 1983. She is married with three children. She has been selling charcoal for 9 years. She works 12 hours per day offering her product from her house. The objective of the loan is to provide her working capital for buying and selling three big bags of charcoal so in the near future she can generate more income. This group is grateful for the support that the lenders of Kiva offer so that their small businesses will grow.

loans.use: to buy and sell three big bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 10 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y variedad de antojitos típicos desde hace más de tres años. Para ella lo más importante es que su querida hija cuente con mejores condiciones habitacionales y es por ella que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar mejores condiciones habitacionales. Marleny desea levantar las paredes de la vivienda para darles un poco más de altura que le permita mayor acceso de luz y ventilación. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento y arena para construir tres hiladas de ladrillo a las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Marleny, age 38, lives in her own house with her ten year old daughter.  Marleny has been selling tamales and a variety of typical snacks for over three years.  The most important thing for her is for her beloved daughter to have better living conditions.  That is why she does everything within her power to give her better living conditions.

Marleny wishes to raise the walls of her house so that they are a little higher, which will allow for more light and ventilation.  In order to do so, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, and sand to build three rows of brick onto the walls of her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand to make the walls of her house higher.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gari, bananas, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: María Genoveva

texts.es:
María, a sus 62 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, dedicada a velar por el bienestar de su familia.
Desde hace 9 años, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, tiene un puesto de venta de alimentos fritos que inició por la necesidad de generar recursos económicos para apoyar a su esposo a solventar los gastos básicos del hogar y brindar educación a sus dos hijos, trabaja sola todos los días de 4 a 11 pm y sus principales clientes son conductores de taxi que transitan por el sector.
El crédito que solicita será destinado para la compra de una freidora grande e insumos para elaborar los alimentos que vende (empanadas, papa rellena, tortas de carne), esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad para brindar educación universitaria a sus hijos y verlos convertidos en profesionales íntegros y exitosos y disfrutar junto a ellos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 62 and  a very hardworking and determined woman whose overriding concern is the well-being of her family. 

María has for the past nine years worked as an independent businesswoman. She went into business selling fried food in a market so she could earn income to help her husband meet their basic household expenses and pay for her children's education. María works every day from 4 to 11 p.m., selling mostly to taxi drivers who drive through her neighborhood. 

María is applying for a loan to purchase a large deep-fryer and supplies for preparation of foods she sells, such as  empanadas, stuffed potatoes, and meat pies. These purchases will allow María to boost production so she can generate higher sales and income. 

María says that her most heartfelt wish is to be able to pay for her children's university education. She wants them to become successful professionals and for the entire family to enjoy a better quality of life.
