loans.use: to purchase a large deep-fryer and supplies for preparation of foods she sells, such as  empanadas, stuffed potatoes, and meat pies.

loans.name: Twiyungure Cb Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is the group leader of Twiyungure group, which means "Let's grow" in English. The group is composed of dedicated women who do different types of businesses, but they have the same vision for transforming their lives. 

Immaculee, as the group leader, sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 25 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas and potatoes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Ngaakoom Group

texts.en:
These seven members of the Ngaakoom group are on average age 32 years old with three children. They all live in Teshie-Accra and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities.

Group members are retail traders of groceries, cloth, fish, corn and cassava dough, cooking items and plastic buckets. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with ID Ghana. They are on their fourth group loan cycle with ID Ghana, and second cycle with Kiva.

Samelia (the woman standing on the left in the photo) is a grocery seller. She intends to use her loan to buy assorted soap, biscuits, matches, detergent, sugar, etc. in Accra, and sell to customers. 

She is married with two dependent children, and hopes to attain with this loan a good profit, to be reinvested in the business and also support her husband to take care of their children.

loans.use: to buy assorted soap, biscuits, matches, detergent, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 4enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, d’habillement, d’oignon, de beurre de karité, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BADIALLO la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagne. Elle compte acheter 10 complets de pagnes légers avec son argent chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
Benkola is a group of married women who average 45 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in Nala II, a village in the commune of Falako, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell cereals, condiments, soap, clothing, onions, shea butter and cakes.  


To meet a massive demand from their customers, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 2nd group loan cycle. The funds will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. 


Badiallo is the group member standing first from the left in the photo. She is illiterate. She is currently a reseller of pagnes. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sets of light pagnes from Bamako wholesalers. She retails her stock for cash to a diverse clientele at the village market. 


Badiallo expects to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to start raising small livestock.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Pasac Ii Group

texts.es:
Manuel, (es último de la foto de izquierda a derecha) tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nahualá, Sololá, tiene tres hijos, el mayor tiene 15 años estudia tercer grado básico, el segundo tiene 5 años y el último tiene 2 años, los dos últimos todavía no estudian, el mayor ya ayuda a su papa en las labores agrícolas. Manuel necesita un crédito para el mantenimiento de maxán, se dedica a esta actividad agrícola desde hace 32 años, toda la experiencia se la transmitió su papá, el sueño de Manuel en el futuro y con los ingresos de la venta de maxán  es construir dos casas para sus hijos y vivir de una manera mejor.
Manuel se dio cuenta que es mejor organizarse en grupo para poder vender a un mejor precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Manuel, (the last in the photograph from left to right) is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his family in the town of Nahualá, Sololá. He has 3 children. The oldest is 15 years and studies in her last year of middle school, the second is 5 years old and the last is 2 years old. The two youngest are not students. The oldest helps her father with agricultural chores. 

Manuel needs a loan to maintain his maxán crop. [Maxán leaves are used to wrap tamales.] He has been dedicated to this agricultural activity for 32 years, learning everything from his father. Manual’s dream for the future and with the income from the sale of maxán is to build two houses for his children and to live in better conditions. 

Manual realizes that it is better to be in an organized group in order to sell his products at a better price.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay laborers to maintain his crop of maxán

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENSO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala I, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de riz, de condiment, de savon, de galette, et d’ustensile. Les femmes du groupe BENSO sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJENEBA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter 75 kg de riz et du sachet plastique chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Benso group is comprised of married women. On average, they are 39 years old and have five children. They live in traditional families in the village of Nala I, in the town of Falako, in the Dioïla prefecture, and in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through family, neighbors, and friendship. They sell rice, condiments, soap, pancakes, and utensils. This is the second group loan for the women of the Benso group. With the goal of satisfying the enormous demand from their clients, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso. These amounts will be used for buying the aforementioned goods. 

The client, Djeneba, the person standing all the way to the right, is illiterate. She currently sells rice. She would like to buy 75 kg of rice and plastic bags from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells for retail prices and for cash, out of her home, and to a mixed clientele. She would like to earn average monthly revenues of 10,000 FCFA, which will be put back into the business.

loans.use: buy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a computer and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas y semilla, será de ayuda para preparar la tierra en la que sembrar maíz y frijol y podrá proteger el cultivo de plagas.
El crédito anterior tuvo efectos muy positivos en su negocio su producción aumento, los granos son de mucha calidad lo que le facilito su venta y mejores ganancias, las cuales ha invertido en el pago de sus deudas y en ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Buenerge has opted for a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and seed, to help him prepare the land where he grows corn and beans, and to protect the crop from pests.

The previous loan had very positive effects on his business, and his production increased. The grains are of a high quality which helped his sales and improved his profits and he has invested in the payment of his debts and offered a better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and seed.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair to expand her business.

loans.name: Karibea Group

texts.en:
Haika is a married woman and a mother of five grown children and one who is in school. She is aged in her late 50s. For ten years now, she has been managing a cafe selling bites like chapati, half cake and other snacks. She also provides breakfast, lunch and juices. Haika has another business selling second hand clothes. She runs her business from 6:00am to 5:00pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This is her seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start her second hand clothes business; all of which she paid back successfully. Haika earned a profit which she used to pay part of school fees and put back to her business. With her new request, Haika will use the loan to replenish her business with new stock of clothes to resell. She dreams that one day she will be able to open another successful business.

Haika will share this loan with her loan group "Karibea" which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with new stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DOSSOUMA, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de gâteau, de galette, de la pâte et grain d’arachide, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BEMA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain d’arachide. Elle compte acheter, 1 sac d’arachide non décortique, et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire, elle le décortique et le met sur le marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de  9.000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans activité.
texts.en:
KOTOGNONTALA is a group of married women who average 35 years of age and four children each. They live in traditional families in Dossouma, a village in the commune of Falako, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through ties of kinship. They sell condiments, cereals, cakes, groundnuts and groundnut paste, flat cakes and miscellaneous merchandise. 

To meet a massive demand from their customers, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, and this is their 2nd group loan cycle. The funds will be used to stock up on merchandise to sell. 

Bema is the group member standing in the middle in the photo. She is illiterate. She is currently a reseller of groundnuts. She plans to buy 1 sack of unshelled groundnuts and some plastic bags from wholesalers at the weekly market. She will shell and package the groundnuts, then she will retail her stock for cash, from her home, to a diverse clientele. 

Bema expects to earn a monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelyn is 29 years old and her child is in school.

Adelyn has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Adelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Adelyn has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional carp fish and feed for her business.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years. Alicia earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional carp fish and feed

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 44 years old and married with two children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, salt, etc. to sell.

Anita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Anita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee and salt to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Meet Daniel, a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya who lives with his wife and four children. He loves farming and has been involved in it for eight years with his income coming from milk and crops. His biggest challenge is insufficient funds.

Daniel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest on their loans and their loans also have a grace period according to the farmer's choice. This loan will enable him to purchase poultry to boost his income and enable him to pay for his children's school fees comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and water by the sack to sell

loans.name: Mrangirangi Group

texts.en:
Edwardina is in her mid-fifties and has four children; three are in school, while one has finished school. She is married, and since 2007 she has had a charcoal business. She works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock sacks of charcoal. 

Edwardina dreams that one day she will be able to make her business operate in wholesale and retail. She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mrangirangi", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Freedom 1 Group

texts.en:
The four members of the Freedom 1 Group are on average 40 years old with an average of two dependent children. They all live in Teshie, Accra and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities. Group members are retail traders of eggs, fish, plates, bowls and cups. In order to increase their operating capital, the group decided to work with ID-Ghana and are on their seventh group loan. 
 
Elizabeth (the woman standing on the left in the photo) is a plate seller. She intends to use her loan to buy plates in Accra to sell to her customers. She is a widow without any dependent child and hope to attain a good profit with this loan. The profit will be reinvested in the business.

They will need a total amount of GHS 2,300 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy plates to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal and palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil by the gallon for her business.

loans.name: Tiberio De Jesús

texts.es:
Tiberio es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 36 años de edad, que lucha incansablemente para brindar sustento a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad.
Desde muy joven conoció todas las labores del campo enseñadas por sus padres y, gracias a ello, hoy en día tiene su propia finca con cultivos de café, caña de azúcar y árboles frutales, las cosechas que recolecta son vendidas en la plaza de mercado de la región y así genera los ingresos para su familia.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, larvicidas), esto le permitirá continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y así poder obtener una cosecha más productiva, lo que le permitirá mejorar los ingresos a la hora de vender el producto en el mercado.
Tiberio, con su espíritu de superación y empuje, quiere seguir trabajando arduamente y en un futuro cercano desea tener la capacidad de cultivar toda su parcela, así mejorará la rentabilidad del negocio y podrá brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y disfrutar con ellos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tiberio is a simple hardworking man from the countryside. He is 36 years old and works tirelessly to support his wife and his children aged 10 and 4.

He learned all about farm work from his parents, starting at a young age. So today he has his own farm where he grows coffee, sugar cane, and fruit. The produce is sold in the local market, and with the money he earns he supports his family.

Because Tiberio wants to grow his business, he is seeking a loan to buy supplies at wholesale prices (manure, fertilizer, and insecticide). These purchases will allow him to continue caring for his crops and he will have a more productive harvest. Income will be increased when it comes time to sell the produce.

With his keen attitude and wish to improve his lot in life, Tiberio wants to continue working hard. In the near future he wants to grow crops on the whole of his land and thus increase income. He will be able to provide his children with a better education and the whole family will benefit from a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy supplies at wholesale prices (manure, fertilizer, and insecticide)

loans.name: Camino Al Cielo Group

texts.es: La Señora Marlene, acompañada, tiene  34 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tiene a cargo tres hijos de las edades de 18, 16 y 14 años, se dedica a la venta de productos elaborados a base de maíz como son tamales, yoltamales, pio quinto, entre otros, así mismo se dedica a la compra de cosechas de temporada. La comercialización la hace en la comunidad y mercado local, principalmente cuenta con la ayuda de sus familiares para la venta de lo que ella produce. Con este crédito piensa invertir en maíz, azúcar, vaso, compra de cosechas de temporada  como es el tamarindo, jocote, mango. El grupo también está integrado por las señoras Tania de 25 años su negocio es la venta y compra de cosechas de tamarindo  y Dina de 55 años  también se dedica a la compra de cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en:
Señora Marlene, age 34, is married.  She is the mother of four children, three of whom--ages 14, 16, and 18--are under her care.  She works selling produce made from corn, such as tamales, sweet tamales, and pio quinto [rum cake covered with custard], among others.  At the same time, she also purchases seasonal produce.  She sells them in the community and in the local market.  She counts on the help of her family members to sell what she makes.

With this loan, she plans to invest in corn, sugar, cups, and the purchase of seasonal produce such as tamarind, jocote fruit, and mangos.  This group is also made up of Tania, age 25, who works selling and buying tamarind, and Dina, age 55, who also works selling tamarind.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, sugar, disposable cups and seasonal produce such as tamarind, jocose fruit, and mangos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more articles and fabrics to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, se encuentra sin capital para surtir el inventario de su tienda, por esa razón se decidió a solicitar otro crédito para comprar golosinas, cereales, jabón, detergentes, granos básicos, bebidas, etc., teniendo la mercadería necesaria continuara satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y generando los recursos económicos que necesita para salir adelante.
Para Graciela el préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio con productos necesarios para que tener mejores ingresos con los cuales a cancelado sus cuotas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Graciela finds herself without capital to stock her store.  Because of this, she decided to ask for another loan to buy snacks, cereal, soap, detergent, basic grains, drinks, etc.  Then she will have the merchandise needed to keep meeting the needs of her customers and generating the financial resources that she needs to get by.

Her prior loan helped Graciela to strengthen her business with necessary items so that she could earn a better income.  This allowed her to pay off her debt and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cereal, soap, detergent, basic grains, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is Aminata, a 38-year-old woman from Waterloo. Waterloo is a rural area in the western district of Freetown. 

Aminata is married to a local worker. She has five children. Her youngest child is seven and her oldest child is 26. Four of her children go to school. 

Aminata started selling palm oil in 2004 to support her family. Palm oil is a key ingredient in local dishes and is the base for many of the spicy and affordable stews (such as ‘crain-crain’ and ‘cassava leaf’) that are cooked in the homes in the area. Aminata works from 7am to 6pm from Monday to Friday while managing her children and her home.

Aminata is a hard-working BRAC Sierra Leone member. In the past, she took out and paid back four loans. In the future, she dreams of opening a larger business. She is grateful for the support provided by this loan, which she is going to use to buy palm oil in bulk for her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, fish, and sausage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, rice and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groundnuts and the ingredients for her Kanya snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wax cotton fabric to sell to her customers

loans.name: Se Valiente Group

texts.es: La Señora Marlene, acompañada su edad  es 41  años de edad, madre de seis hijo de 20, 18, 14, 13, 10 y 7 años, se dedica a la venta de productos elaborados a base de maíz como son tortilla, cosa de horno, elotes cocido, tamales, entre otros, y comercializa sus productos en la comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de sus tres hijos mayores y su compañero para la elaboración y venta de sus productos.  El préstamo lo Invertirá principalmente en quintales de  maíz, cal, leña, hoja de chaguites etc. El grupo también está integrado por las señoras Francisca  de 21 años  su negocio es la compra de cosechas de tamarindo y Ana de 46 años  también se dedica a la compra de cosechas de tamarindo.
texts.en:
Marlene is 41 years old, married, and the mother of six children who are 20, 18, 14, 13, 10, and 7 years old. She works selling products made from corn, including tortillas, corn on the cob, tamales, and others.  She sells her products in the community.  Her three oldest children and her husband help make and sell the products.  

She will invest this loan in quintals of corn, lime, firewood, and banana leaves.  The group is also made up of Francisca, who is 21 years old, and Ana, who is 46 years old.  They both work purchasing tamarind crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, including quintals of corn, firewood, lime, and banana leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell non-prescription medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Marleny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Marleny, se siente complacida con los efectos positivos que ha tenido en su negocio por la buena inversión del crédito anterior, ella conto con la materia prima necesaria, sus ventas aumentaron, las ganancias que ha tenido le permitieron cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente y su familia goza de un mejor estilo de vida.
Marleny requiere un nuevo crédito para comprar maíz, leña, gas propano, aceite, chicharrón, bebidas, pollo, condimentos, etc., con estos ingredientes elaborara pupusas, tamales y tortillas, para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marleny is pleased with the positive effects that the previous loan has had on her business.  She has the primary materials that she needs, her sales have increased, her profits have allowed her to make her repayments on time, and her family benefits from a better way of life.

Marleny is requesting a new loan to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, oil, chicharrones, drinks, chicken, and condiments.  With these ingredients, she will make pupusas, tamales, and tortillas to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas, oil, chicharrones, drinks, chicken, and condiments.

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Ella es Ana, madre cabeza de hogar de 3 hijos a quienes  le ha procurado dar lo mejor o por lo menos a medida de los alcances. Es muy buena amiga madre y consejera y como ella se encuentran a diario miles de mujeres sacando a los hijos adelante con grandes esfuerzos y disciplina.
Como todo,  ella también tiene  grandes metas y sueños y el que ha anhelado siempre es tener el centro de Estética.
Ahorrar no fue tarea fácil pero ella siempre tenía claro que si lo hacía podría ir escalando en busca de esta meta.  
Hoy ha comenzado a dar los primeros pasos en busca de este sueño; pues después de tantos años es hora de dedicarle tiempo a el mayor anhelo, los hijos ya tienen la carrera definida, han comenzado a volar por si solos.
CAMPO ALTO fue la institución escogida para capacitarse y dar marcha al firme propósito; para llegar a este sitio debe tomar dos transportes de ida y dos de regreso, pero ella con el fin de ahorrar ese dinero para el próximo semestre ha decidido levantarse mucho más temprano que de costumbre y cronometrar el tiempo que  lleva llegar hasta este lugar a pie.
Además Ana es consciente de que debe bajar unos kilitos de peso por salud y la carrera que ha escogido le exige estar en forma y mostrar que lo que está estudiando da muy buenos resultados en ella y a la vez será el reflejo para que otras personas sigan el ejemplo.
La experiencia en la primera clase la dejo muy cautivada, pues la calidad humana tanto administrativa como docente le reafirmo que fue la mejor elección.
Ana sabe que no será nada fácil el ritmo de trabajo que le espera de ahora en adelante; pues debe madrugar, caminar más de lo acostumbrado, tanto de ida como de regreso y las siestas de la tarde ya no harán parte del  diario vivir, la lectura y las tareas se convertirán en uno de los mejores aliados, además de todas las responsabilidades que implica ser madre cabeza de hogar.
Por todos esos motivos es que Ana necesita del convenio con kiva, ya que es madre cabeza de hogar y los gastos que tiene son bastantes el convenio con kiva le ayudaría a disminuir los gastos y economizar un poco mas de dinero.
texts.en:
This is Ana, head of household and mother of three.  She has managed to give them the best or at least the best that she could manage.  She is a good friend, mother, and counselor.  Just like her, everyday thousands of women are getting their children ahead through their hard work and discipline.

Like everyone, Ana also has great goals and dreams, and what she has always longed for is to have a day spa.  

Saving up was not an easy task but she always kept straight that if she did it, she would be able to go on rising in search of this goal.

Today she has started to take the first steps in search of this dream, because after so many years it is time to set aside time for her big hopes; her children already have their studies lined up and have begun to fly on their own.

Campo Alto was the institution chosen to train her and put into action her steady plan.  In order to get to this place she needs to take two types of transportation going and two more returning.  However, in order to save money next semester, she has decided to get up much earlier than she is used to and note the time it takes to arrive on foot.

Additionally, Ana is aware that she should drop a few kilograms in weight for her health, and the course of study she has chosen makes it a good idea for her to be in shape to show that what she is studying has given her good results.  Also, she will be a reflexion of what others should do, following her example.

Her experience in her first class left her fascinated, because the human factors, as much as the administrative teaching, reaffirmed that it was the best choice.

Ana knows that the rhythm of work waiting for her won’t be easy from now on, as she needs to rise at dawn and walk more than she is used to--both going and returning.  Afternoon naps will no longer be a daily part of her life, while readings and assignments will be her closest companions, not to mention all the responsibilities of being a mother and head of her household.

For all these reasons, Ana needs a Kiva loan.  Because she is a mother and the head of her household and her expenses are pretty high, a Kiva loan would help her to reduce her costs and save a bit more money.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's registration

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KASSIKE, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de savon, du lait et de fruit et légume. Les femmes du groupe SABALI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente YAMA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter, 20 kg d’atieké, et 5 kg de poisson frais chez les grossistes à Falako. La vente se fait en espèce dans sa gargote au marché au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9.500Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Sabali consists of married women, they are on average 33 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kassike, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They do catering, sell soap, milk, fruits and vegetables. The women of the Sabali group are on their first group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Yama, the first person from the right in the row of people standing is illiterate, and is currently a caterer. She plans to buy 20kg of atieké [side dish made from cassava] and 5kg of fresh fish at the wholesalers in Falako. The sales are made for cash in her cheap restaurant at the village market to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 9,500 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for catering.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DOSSOUMA, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de céréale, de galette, d’habillement, du pain, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AMI la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pain. Elle compte acheter, 4 sacs de pains chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans activité.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma consists of married women, they are on average 28 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dossouma, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell condiments, cereals, cakes, clothing, bread, and various items. The women of the Sabougnouma group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Ami, the second person from the left in the row of seated people is illiterate, she currently sells bread. She plans to buy 4 bags of bread at the wholesalers at the weekly market. Her sales are made retail and for cash at her home, and sometimes as an itinerant saleswoman to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de la banane, de gâteau, de baigne, et de cacahouète. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NIEBA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de cacahouète. Elle compte acheter 1 sac d’arachide non décortique avec les paysans du village. Elle le décortique, et le transforme en cacahouète de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9.000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouma consists of married women, they are on average 32 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala II, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They do catering, sell cereals, condiments, soap, bananas, cakes, doughnuts and peanuts. The women of the Sabougnouma group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Nieba, the first person from the left in the seated row is illiterate, she is currently a peanut seller, She plans to buy 1 bag of unshelled peanuts from the farmers of the village. She shells them and makes them into quality peanuts. Her sales are made retail and for cash from her home, and sometimes as an itinerant saleswoman to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected into the breeding of small ruminants.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Doña Margot es una mujer con 39 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijas. Vive con su esposo y sus hijas, una cursa la primaria y la otra el quinto año de secundaria. Trabajadora, humilde y con muchos deseos de superación. Vive en una comundiad rural, sin embargo no deja de ser un buen punto. Se dedica a su actividad hace 10 años, debido a que vió la necesidad de mantenerse ocupada y asi generar ingresos y poder aportar un poco a su hogar. Tiene un salón de belleza en su casa, tiene acondicionado un cuarto en frente de su casa, el cual construyó con la venta de un carro que ella tenía, asi no descuida a su familia. Se especializó en su trabajo llevando cursos en el Instituto Nacional de Aprendizaje y también en academias privadas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a lo que hace le va muy bien. Cuenta con buenas clientas, a las cuales les trabaja de contado y de crédito los productos para el cuidado del cabello. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en las decisiones a tomar ya sea familiares como de negocio. Es primera vez que solicita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, debido a que necesita cambiar el lavacabezas y la silla que tiene, para mejorar la calidad de los servicios que brinda y asi competir, además de invertir más en materia prima como tintes, keratinas, champus y tratamientos, asi crece y mejora las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia, además la condición de salud de su madre, debido a que está muy enferma y ella anhela poder satisfacerle todas sus necesidades para su enfermedad.
texts.en: Margot is a 39 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their daughters. One is in primary school and the other in the fifth year of secondary school. She lives in a rural community, but is still a nice place. She has been working in her activity for 10 years, since she needed to work and generate income and be able to contribute a little to the home. She has a beauty salon in her house and has set up a room in the front of her house. She built it with the money from selling a car she had, although she does not neglect her family. She specialized in her work when she took courses in the National Learning Institute and also in private academies. Thanks to her hard work and dedication it is going well for her. She has good customers and they pay her upfront and on credit for products and hair care. She has her husband's support in the decisions she makes for the family and the business. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan to reinforce her business, because she needs to change the hair washing sink and the chair that she has. This way, she can improve the quality of the services she offers and thus be competitive. She will also invest in materials such as dyes, keratines, shampoos, and treatments. She can grow and improve her and her family's quality of life. She can also improve her mother's health, because she is very sick and she wants to give her everything she needs for her illness.

loans.use: to buy equipment and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Berlin Group

texts.es: El señor José es un microempresario de éxito tiene   38 años de edad, casado dedicado a la venta de productos elaborado a base de maíz principalmente tamales pisques, tamales rellenos y  tiene dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 15 años, quienes les ayudan a la elaboración y comercialización de sus productos en la localidad y comunidades cercanas, con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de la materia prima maíz, atado de dulce, canela, leña, cal, hoja de chagüites etc. Otro integrante es Julio de 52 años quien tiene una pulpería en su hogar y  la señora Emma de 28 años que se dedica a la venta de tamales y tiene una mini pulpería de granos básicos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
José is a successful micro entrepreneur. He is 38 years old and he is married. He sells products made with corn, mainly tamales pisques (with a bean filling) and stuffed tamales. He has two children, ages 19 and 15, who help him to prepare and sell his products in the area and in the neighboring communities.

With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of basic ingredients such as corn, unrefined whole cane sugar, cinnamon, firewood, lime powder, plantain leaves, etc. 

Other members are Julio, age 52, who has a small grocery store in his home, and Señora Emma, age 28, who sells tamales and has a mini store in her home, where she sells basic staple foods.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients such as corn, unrefined whole cane sugar, sugar, firewood, lime powder, plantain leaves, etc.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente Quince años una joven  pro activa llamada Lina, vivía en una hermosa isla caribeña, esta joven se preocupaba tanto por la naturaleza que en el colegio lideraba los diferentes proyectos ambientales que se estructuraban para Concientizar a los estudiantes de la importancia de proteger y conservar los recursos Naturales; tanto fue el  liderazgo que una vez se graduó de bachiller la profesora de Química la recomendó para que ingresara como contratista a trabajar como promotora social de proyectos ambientales. 
Cuatro años después esta jovencita decidió ingresar como voluntaria a la Defensa Civil Colombiana, queriendo trascender en los sueños que se había trazado, "conservar la naturaleza y enseñar a las comunidades a protegerse" de los fenómenos naturales que se pudiesen generar en la  pequeña isla.  
 Lina  inicio con la Defensa Civil como aspirante, adelantado los diferentes procesos de capacitación que son requisitos para integrar la institución, sin embargo a los tres meses de la incorporación se presento la oportunidad de que ingresar a la Defensa Civil Colombiana como Funcionaria del estado desempeñando el cargo de secretaria y devengando la suma mensual en esa época de $400.000. 
Ella se encuentra estudiando administración empresarial en campo alto y quiere tener más experiencia para poder continuar trabajando  en la defensa civil que es lo que en este momento a ella el interesa, pero para ello necesita del convenio con kiva ya que los gastos mensuales se incrementan un poco y ella no cuenta con el dinero total para poder pagar las cuotas mensuales, agradecería si el convenio se le da y puede continuar con los estudios.
texts.en:
Approximately 15 years ago, a young, proactive woman named Lina was living on a beautiful Caribbean island. This young woman cared so much about nature that she led various environmental projects that were organized to raise awareness among the student body about the importance of protecting and conserving natural resources. She was such a leader that once she graduated from high school, a chemistry professor recommended her to work as a contractor as a social promoter of environmental projects.

Four years later, this young woman decided to enlist as a volunteer in the Colombian Civil Defense (a humanitarian group). There she hoped to follow her dreams that had been outlined, "conserving nature and teaching communities to protect it," from the natural phenomenon that the island generated. 
  
Lina started out as a candidate for the Civil Defense, advanced in the trainings that were required to join the institution. Nevertheless, after three months, she had the opportunity to join the Colombian Civil Defense as a state employee. She worked as a secretary and was earning $400.00 a month.  

Now, she is studying business administration and wants to have more experience in order to be able to continue working in the Civil Defense, which is what interests her. However, for that she needs a loan from Kiva because her monthly expenses have increased and she does not have all the money she needs to pay her monthly expenses. She would be very grateful for a loan from Kiva to help her continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's tuition.

loans.name: Al-Wala'a** Group

texts.en:
Al-Wala'a** is a four-member group from Sana'a, Yemen.  All group members are poor women who strive to have a better life. They applied for a loan in the amount of 150,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Mona is the leader of the group.  She is a 37-year-old married women and a mother of 4 children.  She is a nurse.  Her husband does not have a permanent income source.  She loves her family very much, and she works very hard to help her husband to provide better living conditions for their children.  She is assisting her husband in purchasing home appliances for their house.  She wants to buy a television set, but she can't afford that; therefore, she applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB.  She hopes that she will be able to finish purchasing all home appliances and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a television for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Greetings from Waterloo, a rural area, which is in the north of Sierra Leone’s capital city. 
This is Janet, a local business woman. Janet is married to a police man. They have three children aged 5 to 17 years. 
Janet first started her business in 2002 to help educate her children and is proud that all three of her children are still at school. Janet sells raw cashew nuts to customers. Cashews are grown in Sierra Leone. The cashew are then roasted by her customers and eaten (or sold on) as snacks. Janet works hard six days a week and has developed her business so that she can now employ an assistant to help her. 
She would like this loan to increase her capital so that she can buy more bags of raw cashews. Janet is grateful that her family is doing well and dreams that all her children will finish school with a good education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cashews for resale

loans.name: Al-Ameer* Group

texts.en:
Al-Ameer* is a four- member group from Sana'a, Yemen. All group members are poor women who strive to have a better life. They applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Kramah is the leader of the group. She is a 59 years old widow and a mother of 7 children. Her husband passed away several years ago. She depends entirely in her husband salary and the rent of her apartment since she is uneducated and can't work. She loves her children very much and tries to provide her children with a good education and living conditions. Some appliances in her house are very old and need maintenance from time to time. Kramah decided to purchase new home appliances instead of wasting money for maintenance and buy some furniture, but she doesn't have enough money for all of that, Thus she has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB. Kramah hopes that she will be able to finish purchasing new home appliances and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 64 years old and married with one child. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Anita has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and lives in Bangkal Aguada, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental. She has a retail business where she generates income and provides for her family everyday consumption. For almost three years she has been a retailer. She has many avid customers that regularly buy from her for their personal purposes. 

She needs additional capital to restock her store with more inventory, and for the expansion of her house. She asks PMPC for financial assistance to help her to achieve what she wants and generate more income.

loans.use: to restock her store with more inventory.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUIDIA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de KASSIKE, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon de bois, de sel, de gâteau, de la patte d’arachide, et de la banane. Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SITAN deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle compte acheter, 10 sacs de charbon sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Siguidia consists of married women, they are on average 42 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Kassike, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell charcoal, salt, cakes, ground nut paste, and bananas. The women of Siguidia group are on their first group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Sitan, the second person from the right in the row of seated people is illiterate, she currently sells charcoal. She plans to buy 10 bags of charcoal locally from the village farmers. She sells retail and for cash, at the village market to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected into her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 54, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Andres, her business partner and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Marilyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marilyn dreams to expand her business and hopes to have improvement in their living condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is thankful for the financial help extended to her. She was able to buy additional alkaline filters needed for her business. The loan also helped in her laundry shop and in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hand in hand to provide for their family.
 
Mirasol would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional alkaline filters needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mirasol hopes that her business will continue to exist and dreams of giving her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional alkaline filters needed for her business.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business. Gwena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Gwena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 35 years old and married with two children.

Jenalyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Jenalyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Jenalyn aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jenny Ann

texts.en:
Jenny Ann is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 29,500  PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Jenny Ann has been in this business for 17 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jenny Ann aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Mayra is 50 years old. She is an expert in sewing. Her neighbors prefer the detailed finish that she gives each garment. She lives with her two younger children. Already at university they also have helped her with her work.  Her husband also collaborates to take her to different locations to deliver goods or to buy raw materials.  She’s a strong woman and she’s responsible for the previous credit payments.

She began her work seven years ago, with a small loan given to her by the Fundacion Mujer that enabled her to buy a sewing machine and raw materials.  Generating more money in order to continue buying the different machines she has today.  Currently she does not have sufficient working capital to invest in raw materials and thus is asking for this line of credit with the aim of making clothes out of the fabrics she purchases.

Dona Mayra has a small workshop in her house, but lacks the space to enlarge it.  She currently has five sewing machines and no space to cut her materials. Hopefully she can expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 42 years old, widowed and the mother of six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Corazon has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Corazon has requested a 8,000  PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for four years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Princes Baby

texts.en:
Prices Baby is 24 years old and married but has no children as of yet. As a way of generating income, she was engages in selling glass wares within the Public Market.  She dreamed to make her business viable and profitable in order to earn a higher income to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies.  

Having inadequate capital, Prices Baby is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stock of glass wares like burners, casseroles, kettles, frying pans, pots, glasses and plates to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of glass wares like burners, casseroles, kettles, frying pans, pots, glasses and plates to sell.

loans.name: Mark Suaran

texts.en: Mark Suaran is a father who dreamed to become successful in the future. He is 29 years old and has one infant-age child. To earn a living, he engages in buying and reselling of hardware and accessories within the Public Market. He aimed to improve the business and increase his income in order to sustain the necessities of his family. Having inadequate capital, he is seeking a loan amounting to PHP50,000 to buy more stocks of hardware and accessories to resell. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of hardware & accessories to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients and tableware

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 58 years old and lives in Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She has a retail business where she generates income and provides for her family's everyday consumption. For almost twenty years, she has been a retailer at this place. She has many avid customers who regularly buy from her for their personal purposes. 

Because she needs additional capital to restock her store with more inventory for the business, she asks PMPC for financial assistance to help her to achieve what she wants and thus generate more income.

loans.use: to restock her store with more inventory.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and raising livestock. Lilia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell for her general store business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 53 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Leonora is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of clothing to resell.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 49 years old, married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lorna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase stocks of clothing to resell.

Lorna has been in this business for three years. In the future Lorna would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 27 years old, and married with three children; two of her children are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ana Mae has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Ana Mae has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dioneta

texts.en:
Dioneta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, spices, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

Dioneta has been in this business for 54 years. Dioneta earns more income from raising livestock and fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money for the secure future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her general store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvira has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is 45 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emie has a business selling native bags in the Philippines. Emie has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional native bags to sell. Emie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional native bags to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income raising pigs.  Letecia requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Letecia sustains her business activities through twenty-three previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, diapers, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Christy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising livestock. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, diapers, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Christian Catalina

texts.en:
She is an employee and entrepreneur and a Nicaraguan mother. She is 53 years old and she currently lives with her husband, 2 children and 2 grandchildren.  In her native Nicaragua she works in administration and is also dedicated to preaching in evangelical churches in the Southern Zone of the country.  She is a very spiritual woman, very involved with her family, and works to improve (her) living conditions.

 Since she was a child she has dedicated her own money to business.  She brings goods to Nicaragua that she markets in places she visits.  Maintaining an established client list she wishes to diversify her work and to support her daughter with the sales. Acquiring a food truck, which is listed as and called the Buen Gusto.  With this she hopes to generate employment for her daughter, who is a mother with 4 children that live with her, so that she receives an income.

She has an established business, manages a regional clientele and visits areas like San Vito, Neilly, Laurel, Paso Canoas, among others, along with her husband, who is also a pastor. Making use of this to bring goods to these towns and sell her products. Her loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to resell.
 
She maintains a fixed income and with her new work she can cover the loan payments.  With the food truck she intends to offer fast-prepared food and sell it to the whole community of Paso Canoas.

In Costa Rica she has engaged in business for 4 years, but she has built her entire life on the legacy of her father.  She desires to better the living conditions of her family and to support the household income.  She supports her daughter and her children and is a woman of good principles and grand character.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Rachho

texts.en: Rachho is a male student 26 years old living in Kratie Province. He can earn $6 per day. Now he would like to apply for loan of $500 to pay his tuition fee and buy his study materials. This loan will help him get a bachelor degree.  He hopes that after his graduation he can earn a better salary as well as achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay his tuition feed and buy his study materials

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a hard working mother who was gifted with only one child. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to insufficient income, she engages in a pig -raising business to have an additional source of income. She aspired to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Having limited capital she is seeking for a loan of PHP 26,000.00 to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to make the business profitable.

loans.use: To buy pig feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, du lait, de galette, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente NANA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs d’oignon, 2 paniers de tomates, et 4 sacs de feuilles de baobab sec chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecte dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Siguitemason consists of married women. They are on average 36 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala II, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell condiments, milk, pancakes and cakes. The women of Siguitemason group are on their fourth group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Nana, the first person from the right in the seated row is illiterate. She currently sells condiments. She plans to buy 2 bags of onions, 2 baskets of tomatoes, and 4 bags of dry baobab leaves from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells retail and for cash from home, and at the village market to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita sells firewood in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years and she earns from this. With her income, her previous loan was used for the business and successfully repaid. She was able to start a retail business selling grocery goods in her community. 

She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jeondry

texts.en:
Jeondry has been providing transportation services in his community for more than four years. He earns a good income from this business. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan, used for hospitalization costs, from his generated income. 

Jeondry wants to improve the services and make his business secure. Recently, he took a loan to buy new tires to replace the old used tires. 

In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and save his profits to improve his family's general living conditions and to be able to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cepriana works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cepriana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional eggs, peanuts, chips, etc. to sell for her food vending business.

Cepriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs, peanuts, chips, etc. to sell for her food vending business.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 54 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Asuncion requests 13,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Asuncion has raised pigs for five years and earns additional income from a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estileta

texts.en:
Estileta works hard to support her family. Estileta is married and has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her vulcanizing shop.

Estileta has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Estileta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

Gina is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother with children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a retail vegetable business in the Philippines and earns additional income from renting rooms. Elizabeth requests 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Elizabeth sustains her business activities through 13 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living farming rice in the Philippines. Erlinda requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Erlinda has grown rice for 8 years and earns additional income selling rice.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income as a rice mill operator. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a single parent of one child, Thelma works hard to support her family.

Thelma has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business like meat, fish, vegetables, etc. 

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business like meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to start her husband's new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and other inventories to meet her clients orders

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Rosalinda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 57 years old and married with two children.

Nona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to resell.

Nona has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation and pig fattening.
