Nona aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetables vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food and yakult vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell for her vending business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 38 years old and married with five children.

Florence works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles, and other groceries.

Florence has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Florence aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Kruch's Group

texts.en: Kruch is 50 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family, consisting eight children.  To strive for a living, rice cropping is the only business that she has and it generates about 30,500 KHR per day. Kruch is a second time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Including this loan with her is fifth time borrower who has completely repaid back her past loan with success and with an improvement of her lifestyle as the outcome of the loan. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to level her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to prepare her field in a timely manner so that she can start replant her crop.

loans.use: To level her farmland

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 54-year-old mother who buys and sells brooms and rattan products within her community. She has been in the business for almost ten years. She aims to improve and strengthen her business to provide the necessities of her family. She planned to restock her products but she has limited capital. In this regard, she asks for 35,000.00 PHP to buy more brooms, baskets and other rattan products to sell. 

Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to restock brooms, baskets and other rattan products to sell.

loans.name: Yusnia

texts.en:
Yusnia, 45, is married to Gasper, who is also 45. From her marriage, she has been blessed with five children: Endang, 20, who is in college; Prili, 18, a senior high school student; Julio, 14, in junior high school; Carlos, 12, and Boy, who are both in elementary school. 

Yusnia is a worker in a kitchen in a reformatory, and her husband is a laborer. Yusnia also has a plot of land that she uses to plant crops, such as corn and cassava, to meet her family's daily needs. 

She needs to pay her daughter's education fees but she lacks the money. Therefore, she has applied for an individual loan of 4,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from Tanaoba Lais Manekat. She will use the loan to pay the education fees for her daughter and spend 1,500,000 to buy a pair of piglets to raise.

loans.use: to pay education fees for her daughter and spend 1,500,000 to buy a pair of piglets to raise

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. She also used her loan to buy ingredients for her canteen and also for the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lida hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Marjelene

texts.en:
Marjelene works hard to support three children. She is married and has a hollow block business in the Philippines.

Marjelene requests 46,00 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good waterproof light-source.

Marjelene is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Roseville

texts.en:
Roseville is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Roseville is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Roseville requested a PHP 12500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roseville has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Roseville would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: A villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thy is 34 years old and a married mother of four kids, two schoolchildren and two under-aged kids for school. She earns a living via rice farming and a dessert selling business, which she has done for 14 years. This is her fourth cycle for Thy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loans with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle.  Now in a group of three requesting a loan, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy ingredients to make more dessert for resale. She hopes that she can improve her income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make more dessert for resale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requests 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and rice barns.

Lilia has raised pigs for 6 years and earns additional income growing rice.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and rice barns.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 54 years old and married with five children. Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Raquel would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living it represents, Pacita and her husband plan to continue sending their two children to school so that they will earn a degree and be employed someday. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aims to strengthen her pig-raising business in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she is requesting for a loan of PHP 36,000.00 to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Being a patient and diligent mother, she believes that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling pillow cases and curtains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of pillow cases and curtains to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. Teresita earns additional income from food vending.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of pillow cases and curtains to sell

loans.name: Oeurng's Group

texts.en:
Oeurng is a 59-year-old resident from Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a mother of five children. 

To feed her family, she and her husband raise pigs as the main source of income and work for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 25,000 KHR per day. She is applying for a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  This is not the first cycle for her. She has utilized a previous  loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she joins a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more piglets and feed. 

She hopes that this loan will allow her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and she earns additional income from fishing.

Aurora is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, noodles, snack foods, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like sugar, soap, noodles, snack foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: Ry is 44 years old and a married mother blessed with seven children. She grows rice on five hectares of farmland as the main source of income.  She is fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with successful repayment of her past loans. Her loans enabled her to improve her lifestyle. For this cycle, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She believes strongly that she can obtain a better yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 58 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Marcelina has been pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Donita

texts.en:
Donita is 23 years old with two children.

She earns a living raising chickens in the Philippines. Donita requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Donita has raised chickens for 2 years and earns additional income growing rice.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to  save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Tsegee

texts.en:
Mrs.Tsegee is 61 years old lives with her husband in their apartment in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband Namsrai is retired and stays home. 
Tsegee has been working in the medical field for 30 years and retired in 2004. She started her own tailoring service business soon after her retirement. She produces traditional costumes and modern clothing as well. She has gained lots of experience and has regular customers. She is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase materials to produce a large amount of products to sell to her local customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to produce a large amount of products to sell to her local customers

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion works hard to support her family. Visitacion is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Visitacion requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like thread, zippers, fabric, etc. for her sewing business.

Visitacion has been in this business for 5 years now.

Visitacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like thread, zippers, fabric, etc. for her sewing business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 39 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and rice barns.

Susana has raised pigs for 4 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and rice barns.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 47 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, detergent soap, chocolate drinks, cereal, and cooking oil to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, toothpaste, detergent soap, chocolate drink, cereal, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, detergent soap, chocolate drinks,  cereal, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, 33, is a mother of two children and resides in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Her daily source of income is maize farming and her husband's occupation is a taxi driver. 

This is her eighth time borrowing and the first time borrowing with her joint VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact from her previous loan enabled her to improve her lifestyle.  Now, she is a leader of a group of 2. She seeks 1,400,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Eleneva

texts.en:
Eleneva is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eleneva is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Eleneva has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, and seasonings for her food production business.

Eleneva has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Eleneva would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, and seasonings for her food production business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nougoula, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, d’arachide et de fruit et légume. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente HAMA la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain d’arachide. Elle compte acheter, 2 sacs d’arachide non décortiqué sur place avec les paysans du village, elle le décortique et le met sur le marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 19 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi is composed of married women. They are on average 39 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nougoula, Konobougou township, Baroueli prefecture, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors, and friends. They sell prepared food, condiments, groundnuts, fruits, and vegetables. This is the first solidarity loan for the women of group Benkadi. To meet huge client demand, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loans will be used to purchase the aforementioned products.

Our customer Hama, the first person from the left in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently retails groundnut seeds. She plans to purchase two bags of unshelled groundnuts from local farmers, shell them, and sell them at the market. She retails for cash at the village market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 19,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nougoula, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente RABA la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement de condiment. Elle compte acheter, 2 sacs de sel, 2 sacs d’oignon, 1 sac de feuille d’oignon, 2 paquets de cube Maggi, et de la potasse. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
Group Danaya is composed of married women. They are on average 37 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nougoula, Konobougou township, Baroueli prefecture, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors, and friends. They sell condiments, firewood, and charcoal. This is the first solidarity loan for the women of group Danaya. To meet huge client demand, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loans will be used to purchase the aforementioned products.

Our customer Raba, the second person from the right, is illiterate. She currently retails condiments. She plans to purchase two bags of salt, two bags of onions, one bag of onion leaves, two boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, and potassium. She retails for cash from home and at the village market, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 10,000 XOF, which will be reinvested to raise goats.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan owns and operates a transportation service in the local community to make a living. He has been in his business for four years, and he earns from this. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and used his previous loan to purchase spare parts and new tires. With his generated income, his previous loan was successfully repaid. 

Jonathan wants to continue his unfinished course to find a better career in the future. Without hesitation he took a new loan to pay the school tuition fees. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Ankadignongonye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe ANKADIGNONGONYE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Massoukou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tomate, de baigne, de gâteau, et de l’encens. Les femmes du groupe ANKADIGNONGONYE sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA la premier personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’encens. Elle compte acheter du gueni, du magnokisseni, de l’eau de Cologne, et des bouteilles vides chez les grossistes à Bamako. Après quinze jours de traitement, le produit sera embouteille et mis sur le marché. La vente se fait en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Group ANKADIGNONGONYE is composed of married women. They are on average 35 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Massoukou, Marka-coungo township, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors, and friends. They sell tomatoes, fritters, cake, and incense. This is the fifth solidarity loan for the women of group Ankadignongonye. To meet huge client demand, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loans will be used to purchase the aforementioned products.

Our customer Fanta, the first person from the right in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently retails incense. She plans to purchase gueni (perfumed root), magnokisseni (a perfume conservative), Cologne, and empty bottles from wholesalers in Bamako. After a fifteen-day process, the product will be bottled and put on the market. She retails for cash, from home and occasionally door-to-door, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 12,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for making incense.

loans.name: Loeum's Group

texts.en: Loeum is 37 years old, married and blessed with four kids. She struggles for a living via rice farming and her paid working job. This is the business that she has had for 10 years.  This is the third microloan for Loeum and her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, which enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield that is better than it was before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Solomanibougou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de patte d’arachide, de sel, de l’habillement, et de la farine boulangère. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AWA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habit de friperie. Elle compte acheter des t-shirt chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 8 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi is composed of married women. They are on average 35 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Solomanibougou, Marka-coungo township, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors, and friends. They sell condiments, groundnut butter, salt, clothing, and bread flour. This is the seventh solidarity loan for the women of group Benkadi. To meet huge client demand, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.


Our customer Awa, in the middle in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently retails used clothes. She plans to purchase t-shirts from wholesalers in Bamako. She retails for cash, from home and occasionally door-to-door, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 8,000 XOF, which will be used to pay for the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Bitechi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BITECHI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Solomanibougou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de charbon, de savon, de la galette, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BITECHI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SADIO la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon moderne. Elle compte acheter 7 cartons de savon chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
Group Bitechi is composed of married women. They are on average 32 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Solomanibougou, Marka-coungo township, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship relations, neighbors, and friends. They sell charcoal, soap, pancakes, and miscellaneous items. This is the seventh solidarity loan for the women of group Bitechi. To meet huge client demand, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

The loans will be used to purchase the aforementioned products.

Our customer Sadio, the second person from the right in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently retails soap. She plans to purchase seven boxes of soap from wholesalers in Bamako. She retails for cash, from home and occasionally door-to-door, to a mixed-gender clientele. She is forecasting a monthly profit of 20,000 XOF, which will be reinvested raise goats.

loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ellen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Ellen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of vegetables and spices business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her buy and sell vegetables and spices business.

Glenda has been in this business for five years. Glenda earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 47 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nida has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for 15 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45 years old and married with one child who is in school. Leonida works very hard to provide for them.

Leonida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Leonida has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela vive en la ciudad de Aguaytia, es madre de un pequeño al cual quiere mucho y sobre todo se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante. Para poder tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar Guisela trabaja lavando ropa desde hace un año; Guisela cree que le va bien porque es honrada y sus clientes le tienen mucha confianza.

Guisela está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que l han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora, lo cual le va poder permitir entregar a su trabajo más a tiempo y poder atender más clientes, así mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Guisela lives in the city of Aguaytia and is the mother of a young child who she loves dearly. Most of all, she strives each day so that she can get ahead. In order to generate income to pay for her household expenses, Guisela has been providing laundry services for the past year. She believes she is doing well because she is honest and her customers put a great deal of trust in her.

Guisela is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to purchase a washing machine. This will enable her to perform her work faster and serve more customers. Her earnings will improve as a result. Guisela continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest wish of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: El señor Leandro es una persona humilde, trabajadora y responsable, no tiene muchos recursos económicos,vive en ivirgarzama, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos dependientes a los cuales ayuda con la alimentación y educación, se dedica a la agricultura y su otra actividad es el transporte como moto taxista; lamentablemente en la actualidad está atravesando por una crisis económica y necesita aumentar sus ingresos para hacerse cargo de su familia y afrontar sus obligaciones, ya que lo gana no es suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos, por ello solicita un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, así podrá ofrecer un servicio mas eficiente y lograra incrementar sus ingresos con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia proporcionándoles mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Sr. Leandro is a humble, hardworking, and responsible individual. He does not have a lot of financial resources. Leandro lives in Ivirgarzama, is married, and has five dependent children, so he helps to provide them with food and an education.

Leandro is a farmer, but his other business activity is working as a motorcycle taxi driver. Unfortunately, he is going through a financial crisis at the moment, so he needs to increase his earnings so that he can take care of his family and meet his obligations. What he earns is not enough to cover all of his expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a motorcycle. This will help him to provide more efficient service so that he can increase his earnings. In the end, he will be able to achieve a better quality of life for his entire family by providing them better conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Leyvin Oneydi

texts.es: Leyvin  estudio hasta segundo grado de primaria ya que por muchas dificultades no pudo continuar así que aprendió los trabajos de la casa y del campo , a la edad de 15 años conoció al que hoy es su compañero de vida así que se fue de casa de sus padres para ella formar su propia hogar , tiene dos hijos la mayor  que tiene 10 años asiste a la escuela de la comunidad, su forma de vivir dice que se dedican cultivar la tierra siembra de maíz, frijoles,café, tomates, guineo, lo que cosechan lo venden a comerciantes que llegan a la comunidad y otra parte la dejan para consumo del hogar,en la comunidad no hay electricidad es  por eso que ahora que ve la posibilidad de sacar este crédito para comprar un sistema solar  se siente muy feliz pues mira que pronto podrá ser posible que en su casa puedan disfrutar su familia de tener luz, ya que es muy triste estar por las noches a oscuras.
texts.en:
Leyvin has a second grade education. Due to various difficulties, she was not able to continue her studies, so she learned how to complete the household chores and the farm duties. At the age of 15, she met her life companion and left her parents’ house in order to establish her own household. Leyvin has two children. The oldest child is 10 years old and attends school in the community.

In order to earn a living, Leyvin says that she cultivates the land by planting corn, beans, coffee, tomatoes, and bananas. What she harvests is sold to merchants who pass through her community. Part of her harvest is set aside for household consumption.

There is no electricity in her community. For this reason, she is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy a solar energy system. Leyvin is very pleased to know that it will be possible for her family to enjoy having lights at their house soon since they have been unhappy being in the dark at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Marvie Joy

texts.en:
Marvie Joy is 28 years old and married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business in the Philippines buying and selling charcoal and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Marvie Joy is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

Marvie Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sandra Yolanda

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en el barrio el Dorado perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Sandra se dedica al negocio de venta de legumbres, siembra de maíz, papas y a la crianza de vacas. Solicita el crédito para aumentar el negocio de legumbres, lo utilizará para compra y venta de las mismas. La compra lo realiza en Ambato. Su meta es comprar un terreno propio. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo, la costumbre que más le gusta es la navidad.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the neighborhood of El Dorado, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Emprendedores” (The Entrepreneurs), which is located 20 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office that operates in Guaranda. The group includes 10 members who are from the same community. They engage in agriculture.

Sandra has a business in which she sells legumes, but she also grows corn and potatoes, and raises cows. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her legume business. The money will be used to buy and sell her products. Her business will be conducted in Ambato. Her goal is to buy land of her own. The challenge she faces is dealing with transportation issues.

Sandra likes to go for walks in her free time. The tradition she enjoys the most is Christmas.

loans.use: to buy legumes to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 49 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emelda has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Janet is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing materials for her fishing business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her fishing materials

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge vive en la ciudad de Ica, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día trabaja muy duro como empleado en una empresa distribuidora, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Jorge esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar un televisor, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para que poco a poco pueda tener una vivienda que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Ica. He is a young man who has a great deal of drive to succeed. For this reason, he works very hard each day as an employee of a distribution company. This enables him to earn income so that he can move forward.

Jorge is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy a television which will improve his quality of life. He continues to work so that he can eventually own a home and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Kunthea is aged 34 years and married. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing cassava. Having been in the business for 10 years, the current business earns her approximately 11,600 KHR per day.

Kunthea is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to refill soil in front of her house. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to refill the soil in front of her house

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Virgie works hard to support her family.

She has a business in the Philippines buying and selling vegetables and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Virgie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business buying and selling vegetables.

Virgie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean is 67 years old, a widower and a loving father of five children, three of whom are married and have independent lives while the remaining two still rely on his income. Chhean earns a living by farming rice in a village of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. He has been a rice grower for almost 20 years. With the support of his children, he is able to earn a suitable income of USD 5.00 per day.

Chhean is borrowing a loan in the amount of USD 1,200 to buy a motorcycle to fulfill the family’s transportation needs. This way he can prevent his family members from paying for daily taxi service while going in their desired directions. In the near future, he is aiming to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to fulfill the family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 40 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Stella is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Stella requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Stella has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Stella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La señora Fabiola tiene 21 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta el nivel de bachillerato, no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos ya que aún vive en la casa de sus papas los cuales trabajan duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijas menores, la señora les ayuda con algunos gastos como los de alimentación y pago de servicios. Su principal actividad es de soladora (costura de calzados) actividad que la realiza con una experiencia de 2 años, actualmente trabaja en una empresa desde hace un año, entrega 3 docenas de calzados costurados por día del cual recibe una remuneración de aproximadamente Bs 50 por docena culminada, trabaja de lunes a sábado entregando 16 docenas semanalmente. El motivo del presente crédito es para la compra de una máquina para costura de calzados y así poder independizarse para generar más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus papas con todos los gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Fabiola is 21 years old and was able to achieve a high school education. She has no children who are dependent on her income. Fabiola still lives at home with her parents, who work in order to support their younger daughters.

Sra. Fabiola helps with some of the expenses, such as food and basic services. Her main business activity is assembling shoes and she has two years of experience. At the moment, she has been working for a company for one year. Fabiola receives a shipment of three dozen pairs of shoes to assemble each day and she is compensated approximately 50 BOB for each dozen that she completes. She works Monday through Saturday and delivers 16 dozen pairs each week.

The purpose of this current loan is to buy a sewing machine for assembling shoes. This will enable her to become independent and generate more income. As a result, she will be able to help her parents with all of the expenses.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for assembling shoes.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional medicines to sell.

Mirabel has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling beauty products for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional medicines to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business in the Philippines buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business buying and selling charcoal.

Marlyn has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from selling vegetables.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Santos Adan

texts.es: Santos tiene 30 años nos comenta  que su padre murió cuando el tenia cinco años de edad en los tiempos de la guerra civil de nicaragua en 1980, a el lo criaron sus abuelos  paternos ya que su madre  se los dio cuando el tenia unos meses de nacido , su abuelo fue el padre que no tubo  ya que que el fue quien le enseño a trabajar para que pudiera defenderse en la vida . Su abuelo murió ahora solo vive con su abuela , sus esposa y sus hijos  así que el como el hombre de la familia es quien lleva el sustento diario al hogar ,el cultiva unas tierras que su abuelo le heredo .El quiere hacer el tramite de un crédito para comprar un sistema solar para ser instalado en su humilde vivienda
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old. He said that his father died when he was five years old, which was the time of the Nicaraguan Civil War of 1980. His paternal grandparents raised him shortly after his mother gave birth to him a few months prior. His grandfather was the father he never had and was responsible for teaching him how to work so that he could support himself in life.

Santos says that his grandfather is now deceased, so only his grandmother, his wife, and his children live with him. Being the head of the family, he provides for the daily household needs by cultivating some land that he inherited from his grandfather. Santos wants to request a loan so that he can buy a solar energy system that he can install in his modest home.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 50, is widowed and lives in a village of the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. He is a rice farmer and he supplements his family’s income through working for others for a fee. He has been in this business for 32 years, earning about 46,000 KHR per day to feed his family.

Mao just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. Mao is going to use his portion to buy cows in order to help his farming business. With this loan, he hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to better his family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to help his farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Christy Ann

texts.en:
Christy Ann is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 27,000 (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Christy Ann has been in this business for five years and she also earns more income from fattening pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Emelinda has been in this business for five years and she also earns income from running a boarding house. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jhovy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jhovy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jhovy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, cream, etc. for her general store business.

Jhovy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, cream, etc

loans.name: Yam's Group

texts.en:
Aged 54 years old, Yam is a married mother of seven children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To support her family, Yam has been farming rice and labouring for others for 12 years in the village. Her current business earns her about 27,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Yam’s group, of which she is the leader, consists of two members. She is in her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund, while her fellow group member is in his seventh loan cycle. She has successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family and business. She is going to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell them for a good price in order to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Oern's Group

texts.en:
Oern, 50, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Oern and her husband earn a living as farmers and have been farming rice and working for others for 27 years, earning about 60,000 KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs.

This is Oern’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has only three members. She and her members completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund and Oern has used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Oern is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her family’s business

loans.name: Luchando Por La Vida Group

texts.es: Coordinado por la señora Yara es una mujer emprendedora, microempresaria de éxito, tiene  22 años miembro del grupo solidario formado  por tres socias empresarias es  casada y madre de un bebé de 3 meses,su  negocio  se dedica  a la venta de ropa, zapatos y últimamente está impulsando la venta de bisutería como chapas, pulseras, entre otros. Con el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, zapatos de tacones de dama, zapatos de varón, zapatos de niños, y bisuterías como aretes, pulseras, anillos de acero, etc.  Las otras integrantes son las señoras Cándida de 50 años y dedicada a la venta de fritanga y destace de cerdo, y María de 51 años dedicada a la venta de tortilla.
texts.en:
Coordinated by Yara who is a very enterprising woman, a successful small businesswoman, 22 years old, a member of the Solidarity Group consisting of three entrepreneurs. Married and mother of a three-month old baby, her business is selling clothes, shorts and recently she is promoting the sales of various goods such as metal heel taps, bracelets, etc.

She will use the loan to buy new clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's shirts, women's shirts, shorts, women's high heels, men's shoes, children's shoes, jewelry such as earrings, bracelets, silver rings, etc.

The other members are Candido, 50 years old, whose activities include selling grilled meat and the butchering of pics; and Maria of 51 years old, who sells tortillas.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as trousers and shirts for men and women, shorts, high heels, etc.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a father who has three children in school. He aims to improve their source of living in order to sustain their necessities and finance the education of his children. Due to insufficient income, he plans to improve his variety store in order to increase his income.  

As he has inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of sugar, eggs, cooking oils, rice, fish, meat and frozen foods to sell. Despite problems and difficulties in life, he believes that he will become successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of sugar, eggs, cooking oils, rice, fish, meat and frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
This is Esther. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for her business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

Besides the greengrocery business, Esther practices poultry farming.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Juvelyne

texts.en:
Ma. Juvelyne is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Ma. Juvelyne has been in this business for four years. Ma. Juvelyne earns additional income from a bakery.

Ma. Juvelyne has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish and spices for her food production business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 54-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of nine children. She has been knitting handmade embroidery over wooden frame at her home for many years. During in these years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

To knit embroidery over wooden frames is too slow and is a lengthy procedure, this is the reason she wants to buy a embroidery machine. In this way she can easily complete her tasks on time and can generate more income in a short time. Due to huge household expenses; she does not have enough cash in hand to buy an embroidery machine. 

Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy an embroidery machine. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for resale. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, et 3enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Nala II, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, d’igname, de savon, de beurre de karité, de poisson fumé, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIA la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de choux. Elle compte acheter 8 sacs de choux avec son argent chez les jardiniers à Falako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et au marché du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera injecté dans l’élevage de chèvres.
texts.en:
The group Tiessiri consists of married women. They are on average 33 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Nala II, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They do catering, sell condiments, yams, soap, shea butter, smoked fish, and cakes. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their second group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Kadia, the second person from the left in the seated row, is illiterate. She currently sells cabbage. With her money she plans to buy 8 bags of cabbage from the gardeners in Falako. She sells retail and for cash from home, and at the village market to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in the breeding of goats.

loans.use: to buy cabbage.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de DOSSOUMA, commune de Falako, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de chaussure, de gâteau, de friperie, de savon, de potasse, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente KAMISSA la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habit en fripe. Elle compte acheter, une demi-balle d’habit de la friperie chez les grossistes à Marka-Coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie réinjecté dans l’activité et le reste dans l’élevage de chèvre.
texts.en:
The group Tiessiri consists of married women. They are on average 28 years old and have 4 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dossouma, Falako commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They do catering, sell cereals, shoes, cakes, secondhand clothing, soap, potash, and a variety of items.. The women of the Tiessiri group are on their first group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

The client Kamissa, the first person from the right in the seated row, is illiterate. She currently sells secondhand clothing. She plans to buy a half-bundle of secondhand clothing from the wholesalers in Marka-Coungo. She sells retail and for cash from home, and sometimes as an itinerant saleswoman to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business and the rest in the breeding of goats.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 45-year-old married woman with three children aged between 10 and 15 years. She describes herself as a capable person and she operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her salon is located in an area with good potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of enough capital. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy stocks of cosmetics and other beauty products for her salon. Her business goal is to be very prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cosmetics and other beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Ma. Mariza

texts.en:
Ma. Mariza is a married mother who works hard to support her family through her fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Mariza has been in this business for 10 years now and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka really appreciated her previous loan with the Yehu organisation as it enabled her to expand her business, earn a higher income and improve her living standards.

She is continuing her business of preparing and selling food from her home. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more ingredients such as onions, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more food for her business, such as onions, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Jig

texts.en: Jig owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been doing this for the past six years and is able to provide for his family's needs. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to buy new tires. To further improve the services he provides, he is taking out a new loan to buy leather that will be used to cover the seats of his motorcycle taxi and as a rain coat for his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue this will generate to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new leather covers for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Massoukou, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de dah, de fruits et légume, de gâteau, de la galette, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MOBE la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter 1 panier de tomate, 1 sac de sel, 5 kg de piment, 5 kg de dah, et du soumbala chez les grossistes à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9. 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo consists of married women. They are on average 35 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Massoukou, Marka-Coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell cereals, condiments, bissap, fruits and vegetables, cakes, pancakes, and a variety of items. The women of the Djekafo group are on their fifth group loan. With the goal of meeting the enormous demands of their clientele, they are appealing to Soro Yiriwaso.

These amounts will be used to buy the merchandise already cited.

The client Mobe, the second person from the left in the standing row, is illiterate. She currently sells condiments. She plans to buy 1 basket of tomatoes 1 bag of salt, 5 kg of peppers, 5 kg of bissap and soumbala [African condiment] at the wholesalers in Marka-Coungo. She sells retail and for cash from home to a mixed clientele. She plans to make a monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA, which will be reinjected in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en el barrio el Dorado perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Víctor se dedicaba a la construcción, a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Víctor is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the Dorado neighborhood in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolivar.  He is a member of the Los Emprendedores community bank, which is located 20 minutes from the operations office in Guaranda.  It is made up of 10 members from the same community who work in agriculture.

Victor works in construction, agriculture, and raising pigs.  He is requesting this loan to purchase manure, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and fungicide in order to improve the production of his crops.  He will make the purchases in Guaranda.  His goal is to improve the production of his crops.  His biggest challenge is transportation.

In his free time, he likes to play sports and his favorite custom is Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase manure, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and fungicide.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, 28, is the mother of two children; her husband owns an electrician's shop in which he sells electric tube rods, bulbs and energy-saver bulbs of various brands. He provides services to his clients for electric goods, also.  To grow his business and get maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy electrical wires.
Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy electrical wires. In addition, he wants to buy some extra electrical goods such as switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets and other items to offer his customers. 
This is her fifth loan with BRAC; she describes her wish to make a huge amount after this loan. She hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy electric wires to resell.

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie has owned and operated a retail business for more than eight years and she earns well from this. With the revenue she generated, the previous loan that was invested in her business was successfully repaid. 

To improve sales, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is a married woman. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, potatoes and other items. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high taxation rate. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will operate the business successfully. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of tomatoes, onions, potatoes.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan also helped in her the repair shop and for the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 3 años en el barrio El Dorado perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla de los Emprendedores  se encuentra ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, y que se dedican a la agricultura.
Luis se dedica a la construcción, a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas y borregos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their 3 year old son in the El Dorado neighborhood in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolivar.  He is a member of the Los Emprendedores community bank, which is located 20 minutes from the operations office in Guaranda.  It is made up of 10 members from the same community who work in agriculture.

Luis works in construction, agriculture, and raising cows and yearling sheep.  He is requesting this loan to purchase livestock.  He will make the purchase in Guaranda.  His goal is to improve the sales of his animals, and his biggest challenge is transportation.

In his free time, he likes to play sports and his favorite custom is Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk and maize flour, sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk and maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene 40 años es del departamento de Chuquisaca, desde niña llego con sus padres al trópico de Cochabamba, su familia no tenía muchos recursos económicos y por ello no pudo continuar con sus estudios solo curso hasta primero básico, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo al que mantiene y ayuda en su educación, trabaja arduamente desde muy joven y gracias a su constante esfuerzo pudo llegar a tener dos parcelas agrícolas, una de ellas le dio a su hermano menor para que la trabaje y en la otra ella cultiva yuca y arroz, como vive sola necesita contratar personal para poder chaquear y al próximo año pretende aumentar la producción de ambos cultivos lo que le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir los gastos de estudio de su hijo, actualmente solicita un crédito para la construcción de su vivienda con el fin de mejorar las condiciones en las que vive su familia y ofrecerle a su hijo mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old.  She is from the department of Chuquisaca and came with her parents when she was young to Cochabamba.  Her family did not have many financial resources, so she was not able to continue with her schooling.  She only attended primary school.  She is a single mother and has one son who she supports and helps with his education.  

She has worked very hard since she was young and thanks to her constant effort, she has two plots of farm land.  She gave one to her younger son to work and she plants yucca and rice on the other.  Since she lives alone she needs to hire people to burn the land to prepare it for planting.  Next year she wants to increase her production of both crops, which will help her increase her income and cover her son's education expenses.  

She is currently requesting a loan to do construction on her home in order to improve her family's living conditions and give her son better well-being.

loans.use: to do construction on her house.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her husband by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this business for the past four years. She is very well known for the techniques of stitching. She sews garments for her neighborhood ladies.

To help her continue operation of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has become out of order due to continuous work. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with household expenses.

Uzma thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for tailoring

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 22-year-old man. He describes himself to be committed.

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are local consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals for resale. His business goal is to have a bigger store of cereals within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Manuel es un hombre trabajador quien se gana la vida pro medio de la elaboración y venta de pantalones. Pertenece a una asociación de sastres y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Manuel desea techar el lugar donde tiene sus herramientas para la elaboración de los pantalones para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para hacer la galera para su negocio.
texts.en: Manuel is 38 years old and lives in his own house along with his wife and their 4 children. Manuel is a hardworking man who earns a living making and selling pants. He belongs to a tailors' association and earns his living and supports his household this way. Manuel wants to put a roof on the place where he has his tools of work for making the pants and so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corrugated galvanized steel and wood to make the shelter for his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated steel to roof his business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to have another store and dreams to improve their living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
