Cecil has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines. Cecil requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy an additional trisikad (a pedicab or bicycle with a sidecar).

Cecil has been in this business for two years. In the future, Cecil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia is 62 years old and married with three children. Amancia works very hard to provide for them.

Amancia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Amancia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Darío

texts.es:
Darío, a sus 68 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser un esposo y padre ejemplar, que lucha incansablemente para brindarle bienestar y sustento a sus familia.
Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues tiene una tienda de abarrotes ubicada cerca de un parqueadero de buses de servicio público, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocido por su amplia trayectoria y buen servicio, razón por la que siempre realiza ventas.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado en la compra de surtido al por mayor (granos, café, gaseosas, lácteos, galletería), esto le permitirá mantener sus inventarios con gran variedad para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de su clientela, logrando así mantener la rentabilidad del negocio.
Darío manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener un minimercado, en el que sus clientes encuentren todos los productos que requieran y continuar prestando un excelente servicio, así dejará un buen legado a sus dos hijos para que cuando él falte, tengan una estabilidad económica que les permita disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
68 year old Darío can be characterized as an exemplary husband and father who strives untiringly to offer his family wellbeing and sustenance.
He has been self-employed for more than 20 years and he has a grocery store close to a public bus station. He has the advantage of being recognized for his ample experience and good service, so he always has good sales. 
He will use the loan to supply his store wholesale (buying grains, coffee, sodas, dairy products, and cookies). This will enable him to keep varied inventory to satisfy the desires and needs of his customers, which will keep the store profitable. 
Darío says that his age doesn't stop him from pursuing his dream of having a mini-mart where his customers can find everything that they need and where he can continue giving excellent service. In this way, he will leave his 2 children a good legacy so that, when he isn't there, they will have economic stability that will enable them to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (grains, coffee, sodas, dairy products, and cookies.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel, a 23-year-old mother of one, operates her own farm to make a living. For many years growing and harvesting bananas, she has been able to solely provide for her child. She had to be determined in what she did so that she could earn money for herself. 

In order to enhance her farm, she is borrowing a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to expand the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 22-year-old single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined and diligent. She operates a farm where she grows tea to sell and also keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as bad weather. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to have a reliable business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita, a 46-year-old mother of three, is separated and operates her own farm for a living. It is their main source of income and she had to maintain good cultivation. For ten years when she has been growing and harvesting coconuts and other crops, she has been able to provide for the family. She had to be determined in her work in order to give a better education to her children. 

In order to enhance her farm, she is taking a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Virginia has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running charcoal business for 6 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming flowers.  Nida is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell in her business buying and selling charcoal. 

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies such as threads, material, elastic, lace and more.

loans.name: Chhan's Group

texts.en:
Chhan, 63, is married with nine dependent children. Her family lives in a house with thatch roof located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been running her business for ten years, earning about KHR 60,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 30,000 each day. 

Chhan received her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, five cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Chhan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sokourani, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de savon de fabrication artisanale (gabakourouni), de galette, et de pain. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AWA la première personne à partir de droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon artisanal (gabakourouni). Elle compte acheter 1 sac et demi de savon chez les grossistes à Marka coungo. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11.000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group SABOUGNOUMA is composed of married women, who average 36 years of age and five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sokourani, in Commune de Marka-coungo, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. Their businesses involve condiments, galettes, bread, and artisanal soap. 

The women of the group SABOUGNOUMA are on their second solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, AWA, who is standing first from the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of artisanal soap (gabakourouni). She intends to purchase 1½ sacks of soap from wholesalers in Marka-coungo. Retail cash sales are made to a mixed customer base at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA that will be used to make sure her children's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal soap (gabakourouni)

loans.name: Lidia Maria

texts.es: Doña Lidia, es una mujer comerciante de ropa por  encargo, con muchos esfuerzos ha mantenido a sus 4 hijos que hoy en día son mayores de edad, busca la manera de salir adelante con su actividad económica, por este motivo solicita el crédito para invertir en camisas colegiales, pantalones, camisetas, calcetines entre otros.
texts.en: Lidia sells clothes on order. With a lot of effort she has supported her four children who are now adults. Lidia is looking for a way to get ahead with her work and so is applying for a loan in order to buy to buy school shirts, trousers, t-shirts, socks and more.

loans.use: to buy school shirts, trousers, t-shirts and socks.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy earns a living from selling goods in her retail store, while her husband does farming. For ten years, Juvy earned well and sustained the business. She had competitors in the village, but she never worried, for she had her loyal customers who visited her store and made some purchases. 

To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar zacate molida, harinilla y pagar mano de obra para procesar su propio cultivo de zacate, esto le permitirá tener el alimento necesario en época seca para  su ganado.
Manifiesta que con la inversión anterior pudo incrementar las cabezas de ganado que tenía, sus ingresos aumentaron y su familia tiene acceso a mejora alimentación, vestuario, todos ellos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
Julia has decided to take out another loan in order to buy to buy ground hay and flour, and to pay labourers to start growing her own hay. This will give Julia the necessary food for her cattle in the dry season.

Julia tells us that, with her previous investment, she was able to increase her number of cattle, her income increased and her family had better food and clothing. The family is also in better health now.

loans.use: to buy ground hay and flour, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Clara Ines

texts.es:
Ella es Clara Ines de Bogotá, en primer lugar considera que la vida es de retos, los cuales constituyen el carácter propio de cada ser humano, alcanzar las metas, perseguir los sueños y vencer los obstáculos son elementos indispensables que determinan la identidad, Partiendo de esto considera que estudiar es un reto bastante importante para ella en la medida en que es un factor más para mejorar la calidad de vida y la de la familia, Campo alto sin duda es una institución donde encuentra la oportunidad de hacerlo sin dejar de lado la vida que lleva hasta ahora. 
Le llamo la atención especialmente la flexibilidad de los horarios, ya que puede trabajar al mismo tiempo, además de ello la buena financiación y entre ellas la que ofrece kiva haciendo mucho más fácil la estabilidad económica permitiéndole no desertar en algún momento por falta de dinero.
Sin duda alguna considera que es una institución muy buena, reconocida y con una calidad académica alta, dando lugar a una formación integral en la carrera que ella escogió, la cual es auxiliar administrativo en salud, que aporta grandes beneficios al proceso educativo. De modo tal que en pocos años se vea en una empresa reconocida que apoye el talento humano y las capacidades de cada colaborador, una empresa donde pueda hacer uso provechoso de todo lo que aprenda en Campo alto, y desde luego una que aporte a la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
She is Clara Ines from Bogotá.  In the first place, she feels that life is full of challenges, which comprise each human being’s own character.  Achieving goals, following dreams, and overcoming obstacles are indispensable elements that determine identity.

Based on that, she feels that studying is a very important challenge for her in so far as it is one more factor involved in improving her quality of life and that of her family.  CampoAlto is, without a doubt, an institution where the opportunity to do so is found without leaving behind the life she has led so far.

The thing that especially catches her attention is the flexibility of the schedules.  This is because she is able to work at the same time.  The good financing, which Kiva is a part of, also catches her attention.  This makes financial stability much easier, allowing her to not withdraw at some point due to the lack of money.

Without a doubt, she feels that it is a very good, well-known institution of high academic quality.  This will bring about a comprehensive formation in the career that she has chosen.  She has chosen the career of being an assistant in health administration, which contributes good benefits to the educational process.  In a few years she sees herself at a well-known company that supports human talent and the capabilities of each employee.  It is a company where she will be able to beneficially use everything that she will learn at CampoAlto.  It will certainly contribute to her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FOTEMOGOBAN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Degui, commune de Marka-coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de couscous sec, de beignet, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KOYAN la personne assise au milieu est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter, 25 kg de haricot, et du beurre de karité chez les grossistes au marché de Marka-coungo. La vente se fait en espèce dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group FOTEMOGOBAN is composed of married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Degui, in Commune de Marka-coungo, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, couscous, beignets, and general merchandise. 

The women of the group FOTEMOGOBAN are on their third solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, KOYAN, who is sitting in the middle, is illiterate. She is currently a restauranteur. She intends to purchase 25 kg of beans and some shea butter from wholesalers at the Marka-coungo market. Sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her stall. She plans on making a monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making beignets

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Aliadas Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES ALIADAS
Doña Juana,  es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 24 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hijo de 4 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de pollos.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero, y gracias al apoyo de el, ella sigue adelante con su negocio que lo viene realizando desde hace algunos años.
Con el crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en  materia prima para sus tejidos y también en compra de pollos y concentrado.
Ella sueña en tener un negocio mas  grande para surtirlo con  diferentes estilos de tejidos ,  asi  obtendrá mejores ganancias, para poder mandar a su hijo a una mejor escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Aliadas" due

Juana is originally from Tecpan. She is 24 years old and has a four-year-old son. Juana makes a living producing typical woolen products by hand, and raising chickens.

Juana's husband works as a labourer and, thanks to his support, Juana is able to move forward with her business, which she has had for a number of years.

Juana has used this loan to buy basic supplies for her knitting work, and also to buy chickens and feed.

Juana dreams of having a bigger business in order to stock it up with different types of knitted products. She would then make a higher income in order to send her son to a better school and for him to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for making a selling typical woolen products.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: María tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y y tres hijos de 14, 12 y 6 años de edad. Desde hace más de tres años logro establecer un pequeño negocio de venta de variedad de antojitos típicos como: yuca frita, papas fritas, pasteles de carne, etc. De esta forma es como María y su esposo llevan el sustento a su hogar y mantienen a sus hijos. María desea elaborar un pequeño cuarto dentro de la vivienda con el fin de dar mejores condiciones  habitacionales a su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para la respectiva construcción.
texts.en:
María is 36 and lives in her own house along with her husband and her three children, 14, 12 and 6 years old. Since more than three years ago, she achieved establishing a small business selling a variety of typical snacks like: fried yuca, french fries, meat pies, etc. This is how María and her husband bring sustenance to their home and maintain their children.

María wishes to make a small room inside her home with the objective of giving better living conditions to her family. For this, she is applying for this FUSAI loan to invest in the purchase of galvanized roofing and wood for said construction.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing and wood to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase household items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, shampoo, chips, etc., for her general store business.

Julie has been in this business for three years. She also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase household items to sell, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, shampoo, chips, etc.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van is 55 years old and married with seven children. She lives in a rural area of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey Province. For almost forty years, Van has made a living farming rice and growing vegetables. She earns about 34,000 KHR each day to meet her family’s needs. Van has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has completely paid back her previous loans that helped her better support her family. 

Van is the leader of a group loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for her farmland. In the future, Van hopes to make more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chanbophea

texts.en:
Chanbophea is 44 years old living with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Koh Sotin district. All of her children are still in school. Growing tobacco and working as a teacher are the only sources for her family’s income and she has been this business for 24 years. She is able to save 70,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Chanbophea with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying a computer for her children. She hopes to earn more crops and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Degui, commune de Degui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de tomate, d’habillement, du pain, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente HABI  la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement d’habit. Elle compte acheter, 10 complets de pagnes chez les grossistes à Bamako La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, et à Marka coungo a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 19 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group SABOUGNOUMA is composed of married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Degui, in Commune de Degui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in tomatoes, clothing, bread, and general merchandise. 

The women of the group SABOUGNOUMA are on their third solidarity loan. To meet the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

This client, HABI, who is standing first at the left, is illiterate. She is currently a [vendor] of clothing. She intends to purchase 10 outfits of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers in Bamako. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home and in Marka-coungo. She plans on making a monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing made of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Alma Pablo

texts.es:
DOÑA ALMA
Ella es originaria de Tecpán, tiene 29 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 3 hijos uno de 6 años, uno de 3 años y uno de 6 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de suéteres, trajecitos para bebes y se dedica a elaborar  tejidos típicos a mano.
El esposo de ella tiene una pequeña fabrica de suéteres donde elabora los suéteres y después sale a venderlos en las tienda y en el mercado, gracias al apoyo de el doña alma sigue adelante con su negocio.  
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para elaborar suéteres, también materia prima para sus tejidos típicos.
Ella sueña con ampliar mas su negocio surtirlo con mas variedad de productos ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
ALMA

She is 29 years old, from Tecpán, and has three children, ages 6, 3, and six months.  She sells sweaters, baby clothing, and does typical knitting by hand.

Her husband has a small sweater factory where he makes the sweaters and then goes out to sell them in stores and in the marketplace.  Thanks to his support, Alma continues ahead with her business.

She used the loan to buy sweater making and knitting supplies for her typical knitting.

She dreams of expanding her business and stocking it with a greater variety of products since she will have more earnings so she can support her children in school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Diana Ximena

texts.es:
Diana tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus dos hijas de 6 y 2 años en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Diana se dedica a la agricultura, y a la crianza de cerdos, también se desempeña como empleada doméstica. Solicita el crédito para compra de pollos con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio. La compra la realiza cada 8 días y vende su producto cada 3 meses en Guaranda. Sus metas son: que sus hijas sigan estudiando y tener más producto para vender. Su desafío es no poder llegar pronto al trabajo por el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa, la costumbre que más le gusta son las reuniones y las fiestas.
texts.en:
Diana is 23 years old and single. She lives with her 2 daughters who are 6 and 2 years old in the community of Rumi Loma, which is in the canton of Guaranda and the province of Bolívar.
She is a member of the community bank Reyna del Cisne, which is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the operational office in Guaranda. It is comprised of 10 members who all work in agriculture. 
Diana is a farmer, raising pigs, and is also employed as a maid. She is requesting the loan to buy chickens with the goal of growing her business. She wil make the purchases every week and sell her chickens every three months in Guaranda. Her goals are: that her daughters keep studying and that she has more livestock to sell. Her challenge is not being able to get to work on time because of the transport. In her free time she likes to tidy the house and the things that she likes most are get-togethers and parties.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Eden works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Eden is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Julie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business like a fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Julie has been in this business for three years. Julie earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Willian Oswaldo

texts.es:
Willian tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo de 4 años, vive solo en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Willian se dedica a la agricultura, y como chofer en la Coop San Pedrito. Solicita el crédito para compra de maíz y arroz lo cual lo guarda para luego venderlo. La compra la realiza cada semana y la venta cada mes en Guaranda.  Su meta es ser más productivo con el apoyo de la cooperativa. Su desafío son los viajes muy largos. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Willian is 27 years old and single. He has a 4 year old son. He lives alone in the community of Rumi Loma, which is part of the canton of Guaranda and the province of Bolívar. 
He is a member of the community bank Reyna del Cisne, which is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the operational office in Guaranda. It is comprised of 10 members who are all farmers.
Willian is a farmer and also works as a driver for Coop San Pedrito. He is requesting a loan to buy corn and rice which he will later sell. He will buy the goods every week and sell every month in Guaranda. His goal is to be more productive with the support of the cooperative. His challenge is making long journeys. In his free time, he likes to play sports. The custom that he likes most is the carnival.

loans.use: to buy corn and rice.

loans.name: Otilia Argentina

texts.es:
Otilia, necesita capital para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, bebidas, papas, leche, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, etc., estos son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para la producción de antojitos y meriendas.
La inversión del crédito anterior le ayudo a contar de manera inmediata con todo lo necesario para mantenerse trabajando, ha aumentado su clientela, su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Otilia needs capital to buy dried corn, beverages, potatoes, milk, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  These are some of the ingredients she will use to make her snacks and food.  The previous loan helped her get everything she needed to continue working.  Her number of customers has increased and her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 36 años, vive junto a dos de sus hijos, ella es empleada, en el tiempo libre como una forma de tener ingresos extras desde hace un año se dedica a vender pupusas y ropa los días de comercio, para realizar estas actividades la apoya su hija.
Se decidió por un crédito para adquirir mercadería por mayor para mantenerse trabajando, Rosa utilizara el crédito para comprar variedad de ropa, harina, quesillo, aceite, aderezos, bebidas, entre otros, espera aumentar la clientela, mejorar sus ventas y mejorar su economía.
Aspira tener un negocio que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, lives together with two of her children. She is employed. In her free time, as a way of having extra income, for one year she has been working selling pupusas and clothing on business days. By doing these activities, she supports her daughter.

She decided to acquire merchandise in bulk to keep working by a loan. Rosa will use the loan to buy a variety of clothing, flour, cheese, oil, dressings, drinks, among others. She hopes to grow her clientele, improve her sales and improve her finances.

She aspires to have a business that will permit her to improve the quality of life of her family and fulfill her monetary commitments.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, flour, cheese, oil, dressings, drinks, among others.

loans.name: Mirriam Mbinya

texts.en:
Mirriam is a youth living in Muthurwa,Nairobi Kenya. She recently left school and has been looking for a job without any success. Mirriam looked around and decided to venture into business. She then learned about the Fresh Life Initiative, a movement to improve community sanitation. Mirriam loved the impact of Fresh Life toilets on the community and wanted to be part of the movement. 

Mirriam is requesting a loan to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to improve her community and increase her income. She will use the income from her loan to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 41 years old and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Sokha and her husband earn a living through planting cassava and working as paid workers. She is an existing VisionFund client and has received and repaid two previous loans. Her loans helped her family relieve financial their burden to a great extent. 

Sokha is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 48 years old and married with six children. For the past seven years, she has earned an income as a rice farmer in the Philippines. Editha earns additional income from making nipa (thatch roofing). 

Editha is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan from NWTF to pay the salaries of laborers who clean her rice fields. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to pay salaries of laborers who clean her rice fields.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and is married with five children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 11 years, she has run a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rosario is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosario is requesting a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen, 25, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been raising pigs and growing cassava for seven years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Chen is with VisionFund for this cycle. She is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy piglets and pig feed, and she uses a portion of it to spend on buying fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Carlos Vinicio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año, vive solo en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Carlos se dedica al comercio de gallinas y ovejas, también se desempeña como chofer en la Coop. San Pedrito. Solicita el crédito para comprar ovejas. La compra la realiza cada 8 días y la venta cada mes en Guaranda. Su meta es tener un negocio propio. Su desafío es que no cumplen con las 8 horas de trabajo. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte , la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Carlos is 30 years old, unmarried, and has 2 kids who are 4 and 1 year old. He lives alone in the community of Rumi Loma, which is part of the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.
He is a member of the community bank Reyna del Cisne, which is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes away from the operational office in Guaranda. It is comprised of 10 members who all work in agriculture.
Carlos works selling chickens and sheep and is also employed as a driver at the Coop San Pedrito. He is requesting a loan to buy sheep. He will buy them every week and sell them every month in Guaranda. His goal is to have his own business. His challenge is not completing 8 hours of work. In his free time his likes to play sports and the custom he likes the most is the carnival.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old and married with three children.

Christine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

She has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Christine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 29 years old with two children.  With two children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Maribel has been in this business for four years.

In the future Maribel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Guadalupe Beatriz

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad,  vive con su esposo en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Guadalupe se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas. Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos necesarios para la siembra de granadilla. La compra lo realiza cada 15 días en Guaranda y la venta del producto es cada 8 días. Su meta es avanzar para alcanzar el progreso. Su desafío son los fenómenos naturales y las plagas. En su tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa, la costumbre que más le gusta son las reuniones que se realizan en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 37, married, has two children, 18 and 19 years old. She lives with her husband in the community of Rumi Loma, which is part of Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Reyna del Cisne village bank, which is found located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the operating office of Guaranda. It is made up of 10 members, which make their living in agriculture.

Guadalupe works in agriculture and in cattle raising. She is applying for the loan for the purchase of the necessary fertilizers for planting passion fruit. She will carry out the purchase every 15 days in Guaranda and the sale of her product is every 8 days. Her goal is to advance for achieving progress. Her challenges are the natural phenomenons and pests. In her free time, she likes to clean the house. The custom she likes most is the reunions that they do in her community.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary fertilizers for planting passion fruit.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de quesos. Ella vive en Achacahi. Sus productos son vendidos en diferentes ferias de El Alto. Elizabeth necesita credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su produccion de quesos. Ella es una buena clienta y trabaja muy duro, por lo que se aconseja confiar en ella.
texts.en: Elizabeth makes a living from the sale of cheese. She lives in Achacahi. Her products are sold in different fairs in El Alto. Elizabeth needs a loan to buy a milk cow that will allow her to increase her production of cheese. She is a good lender and works hard, so she recommends to trust her.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Jessica Beatriz

texts.es: Jessica tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de un año de edad. Ella es una mujer increíble quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para ganarse el pan de cada día. Jessica trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo y junto a su esposo llevan el sustento de su hogar y ajustan para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Jessica desea pavimentar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra además desea comparar ventanas y así dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Jessica, 27, lives with her husband and their one year old child in their own home. She is an amazing woman who does everything in her power to earn their daily bread. Jessica has worked as a maid for a long time, and together with her husband has sustained her household and made adjustments to cover the cost of their home. Jessica wants to pave the floor of their house, which is currently a dirt floor, and also wants to purchase windows in order to provide greater security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel and windows to pave the floor of her home and to make it more secure.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Being a responsible father, Antonio aims to improve his standard of living in order to give his family a better life. He is 58 years old and has two adult children. They currently reside in a rural community and make their living through farming. They also run a variety store to earn additional income. Antonio wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items but he does not have enough capital to do so. For this reason, Antonio is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stocks of snack foods, soft drinks, mineral waters, seasonings, and beverages to sell. He hopes that his loan will help him to make more improvements to the business.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of foods and beverages to sell

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Khun is aged 60 and married. She has six children, one of whom is still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and raising pigs for 12 years. She can earn about 16,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Khun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food and to support her child’s education. 

Now Khun is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. Andrea has been in this business for 3 years.

She has requested a PHP 5500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, and gravel and to pay for laborers' salaries.

In the future, Andrea would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, sand, and gravel and to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Anneva

texts.en: Anneva is a 39-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as visionary and focused. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and dairy cows and also grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a productive and fertile place, and her primary customers are local residents. Anneva describes her biggest business challenge as price fluctuations. She will use the requested loan of KES 10,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 58, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a driver, and she is the mother of their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Aida maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one month to pay. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers receive as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Aida is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. 

Aida dreams of expanding her business and hopes to improve her family's standard of living. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Resevil

texts.en:
Resevil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, diapers, chips, etc.

Resevil has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Resevil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, spices, diapers, chips, etc

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is single and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 4,500 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and equipment for her bicycle.

Violeta has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and equipment for her bicycle

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años carolina  quería estudiar, ella quería tener un mejor futuro, pero desafortunada mente ella no contaba con suficiente dinero ni el apoyo de nadie.
Cierto día se decidió por  estudiar e hizo cuentas de todo lo que se gastaba en casa, al hacer las sumas y restas  vio que los hijos necesitaban más cosas para el colegio y ese año decidió no estudiar ella  pensó primero en el estudio de ellos los hijos, en el transcurso de los días conoció personas, ellos  hablaban de las clases y como habían facilidades de pago. 
Este año vio la oportunidad y ella decide estudiar  esta carrera, a ella le gustaría trabajar en un futuro en los hospitales ya que ella tiene facilidad para entrar a un hospital y trabajar y  vio que en la salud necesitan gente con buen servicio, humildad, una mano amiga ya que en esos momentos es cuando ellos necesitan de la ayuda de los demás tiene que mirar desde muy adentro del  ser que ellos son personas enfermas con necesidades y dificultades y no cuentan con los recursos suficientes. 
Carolina  para poder lograr esto necesita prepararse, estudiar seguir con los contactos en la rama de la salud, para tener mejores propuestas de trabajo en los hospitales y clínicas y seguir adelante con los hijos y poderles brindar  universidad ya que sin un titulo es muy difícil conseguir un trabajo bueno.
Ella agradece  a convenio KIVA para que ellos la tengan en cuenta, ella necesita de la colaboración y cumplir una meta importante para la vida personal, ya que desde muchos años esto es un sueño y ella lo quiere cumplir estudiando administración en salud
texts.en:
Carolina wanted to study for several years. She wanted a better future, but unfortunately she did not have enough money nor anyone's support. One day she decided she wanted to study nonetheless. She added up her expenses, but when calculating these, she noticed that her children needed more things for school and decided not to start her studies that year. However, she later met people who told her about the courses they were taking and how there were different payment schemes available. That year she saw the opportunity and decided to go to college.

She would like to work in a hospital. She has seen that in the health sector they need people that provide good service, that are humble and give a friendly hand, since in tough situations people need the help from others. She feels for the sick, who have needs, difficulties and do not have enough economic resources.

To realise her dream, Carolina needs to prepare herself, to keep studying, and to keep her contacts in the health sector. This will allow her to have better job opportunities in hospitals and clinics, to get her children ahead, and to allow them to go to the university since it is very difficult to get a good job without a degree.

She thanks Kiva for taking her into account. She needs the collaboration of Kiva lenders in order to achieve an important goal in her personal life. She has had this dream for many years, to study health administration.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition fee

loans.name: Sreyoun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Sreyoun, 30, has a total of two children, one of whom is in school while another one is too young for school. To make a living, Sreyoun has been farming rice for eight years. She can earn about 13,000 KHR per day.  

Sreyoun has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sreyoun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and also hopes to make more rice to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Doña Alicia
Ella es originaria del municipio  Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 51 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus 9 hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la siembra de tomate y a la producción de hongos chinos OSTRAS.
El esposo de ella trabaja como profesor y  gracias al apoyo de el y de toda su familia  ha podido salir  adelante con su negocio.
Con el crédito que ella recibió lo utilizo en compra de insumos para agricultura e insumos para sus siembras de hongos.
Ella sueña  ampliar mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias  y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is 51, married, and the mother of nine children under the age of 18. The family lives in her hometown of Tecpan, Guatemala. Doña Alicia works as a small farmer and grows tomatoes and Chinese oyster mushrooms.  

Doña Alicia's husband is a teacher and the support that he and the rest of the family provide have allowed her to start and grow her business. She is applying for a loan to purchase supplies for her farming operation, such as mushroom seeds. Doña Alicia hopes to expand her business and boost her income so that she'll be able to send her children to school. Her ambition is for them to get an education and achieve a better future.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Emily is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Emily has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is married with ten children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosana is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosana has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. She has requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like fruits, sugar, and milk.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like fruits, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Gloria Elisa

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Gloria es agricultora, también se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos. La compra la realiza cada 8 días y vende cada 4 meses en Guaranda. Su meta es tener su negocio propio. Sus desafíos son resolver problemas familiares con sus hermanos. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a otros lugares, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old, single, and has two children aged 15 and 13. She lives with her children in the community of Rumi Loma in the Guaranda Cantón, Bolivar Province.

She is a member of the Ventanilla Reyna del Cisne, which is located in the community of Rumi, 30 minutes away from the Guaranda operating office. It is composed of 10 partners, all of whom make a living from agriculture.

Gloria is a farmer, also raising chickens and pigs. She is requesting this loan to buy pigs. She shops every 8 days and sells her products every 4 months in Guaranda. Her goal is to have her own business. Her challenges are to solve family problems with her brothers. In her free time she enjoys going to other places. Her favourite custom is the carnival.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 41-years-old and married with three children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from E-Loading (mobile prepaid load).

Milagros aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyungerel is 28-years-old lives with her mother and two daughters in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, on her relatives' plot of land in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her mother is retired and stays at home. Her daughters are under the age of 7 and attend the local primary school and kindergarten.
 
Oyungerel started her own clothes retail business in June 2012 in a rental stall of the local market. She has gained a lot of experience since then and has regular customers of her own. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of clothes inventory from Erlian, China. She is a hardworking, positive and diligent woman who wishes to raise her daughters as good people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothes inventory from Erlian, China

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling school and office supplies in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items for resale.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for eight years,

Lorna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase addiitonal items for resale.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 56-years-old and married with four children.

Susanita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Susanita has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 29 years old and has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rochelle is borrowing 4,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rochelle has been raising pigs for years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 54-years-old with seven children, two of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Galo Bolivar

texts.es:
Galo tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su madre en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Galo se dedica a la agricultura, y a la crianza de gallina, cuyes y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para compra de ovejas. La compra la realiza cada semana en Guaranda y la venta la realiza cada mes. Sus metas son: seguir adelante, estudiar, cultivar más productos. Su desafío es no tener problemas. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Galo is 35, single, lives with his mother in the community of Rumi Loma, which belongs to the Guaranda Canton, Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Reyna del Cisne village bank, which is found in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the operating office of Guaranda. It is made up of 10 members, who make their living in agriculture.

Galo works in agriculture, and raising hens, guinea pigs and pigs. He is applying for this loan to buy sheep. He will carry out the purchase every week in Guaranda and will sell every month. His goals are: continue moving forward, study, grow more products. His challenge is not having problems. In his free time, he likes to play. The custom he likes most is Carnaval.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Karem Vanesa

texts.es:
Karem es una mujer pujante, activa y emprendedora, a sus 27 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 6 años al que ha sacado adelante con empeño y dedicación.
Hace 2 años inició su propio negocio, una papelería y almacén de variedades que ubicó en un espacio de su casa, la idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y velar por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo.
Con el crédito que solicita tendrá la posibilidad de comprar una máquina fotocopiadora, con lo que podrá ampliar los servicios que ofrece y así  mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Karem, motivada por el amor a su familia, expresa que su mayor propósito es seguir luchando para acreditar y ampliar su negocio, logrando obtener una mayor rentabilidad para ofrecer a su hijo una educación de buena calidad y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida junto a las personas que ama.
texts.en:
Karem is a vigorous, active and enterprising woman. She is 27 and lives with her husband and her 6 year-old son, who she has gotten ahead with effort and dedication.

Two years ago, she started her own business - a paper and varieties store that is located in the space of her house. The idea came up because of the necessity of generating resources to support her husband with the economic burden of the home and looking after the wellbeing of her small son.

With the loan that she is applying for, she will have the possibility of buying a photocopying machine, with which she will be able to increase the services that she offers and thus improve the income that she gets for her work.

Karem, motivated by the love of her family, expresses that her main goal is to continue fighting to accredit and grow her business. Thus she will achieve obtaining a better profitability to offer her son an good quality education and enjoy better living conditions with the people she loves.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Jaffer

texts.en:
Jaffer is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a transport service business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a favorable location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be small returns. 

Jaffer will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy land in order to do farming. This will enable him to increase his income. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy land in order to do farming.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the loan in her computer shop. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Araceli dreams to have an extension for her store and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Chansina

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Moungkul Borey District of the Banteay Meanchey province, Chansina is 22 years old and single. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about US$2 per day, but she can save about US$1 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the first micro loan for Chansina with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her university's tuition. She hopes this loan will keep her in school until graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her university's tuition.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a buying and selling of jewelry business in the Philippines.

She requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of jewelry to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 14 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Isaac Alexander

texts.es: Isaac tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Isaac trabaja como empelado revisando equipos y en mantenimientos mecánicos en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Isaac solicita este crédito a FUSAI para continuar construyendo su vivienda  dado que no ha podido terminar por sus medios. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Ya cuenta con una parte de ladrillo y otros materiales por lo que no comprará el material completo.
texts.en: Isaac is 23 years old and lives in his own home with his unmarried girlfriend. They have a one year child together. Isaac works as foreman, supervising teams and mechanical equipment at a company close to his home. Isaac is applying for a loan with FUSAI in order to continue construction on his home because he has been unable to do so with his own resources. With this money, he will purchase cement, sand, bricks, and iron. He already has some of the bricks and other materials, but he needs to finish purchasing everything he needs.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, bricks, and iron to continue building his home.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has two children with ages 5 years and 8 years. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales in some months. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda works hard to support her family. Herminigilda is married and has a buying and selling of coconut vinegar business in the Philippines.

She requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vinegar to sell.

Herminigilda has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Herminigilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vinegar to sell

loans.name: Henry Rolando

texts.es:
Henry tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Henry se desempeña como chofer del bus Universidad de Bolívar, también se dedica al comercio de vacas. Solicita el crédito para sus estudios y compra de útiles. La compra la realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es culminar sus estudios. Su desafío es no tener problemas con sus compañeros. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Henry is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the community of Rumi Loma, which belongs to the Guaranda canton, province of Bolívar.
He is a member of the Reyna del Cisne community bank, which is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the Guaranda office. It is made up of 10 members, who work in agriculture.  

Henry works as a bus driver for the Universidad de Bolívar. He also works in the cow trade. He is asking for the loan to pay for classes and to buy school supplies. He will make his purchases in Guaranda. His goal is to finish his studies. His challenge is not having trouble with his classmates. In his free time, he likes to play sports and the tradition he likes the most is carnaval.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies and classes

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su hermana, en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Eduardo es oficial del bus Cándido Rada. Solicita el crédito para comprar útiles y así seguir con sus estudios. Los estudios los realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es terminar la carrera. Su desafío es el no poder concluir con los estudios. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 24 yers old. He is single and lives with his sister in the community of Rumi Loma, which belongs to the Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the Reyna del Cisne community bank. It is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the Guaranda office. It is made up of 10 members who work in agriculture.  

Eduardo is a bus official for Cándido Rada. He is asking for the loan to pay for school supplies and to continue with his studies. He goes to school in Guaranda. His goal is to finish his major. His challenge is not being able to finish his studies. In his free time, he likes to play sports. The tradition he likes the most is carnaval.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: Gabil is 31 years old man. He is married with three children. The oldest child is 6 years old and will go to first class in the next year, another child is 4 years old and the youngest child is 2 years old. Gabil’s wife teachs literature. They live in Bala Bahmanli village in Fuzuli region, but for over 21 years Gabil has been an Internally Displaced Person from his native city, Fuzuli. Previously, Gabil borrowed from Kiva organization for his retail business. Then he changed his business. Now he has been in an agriculture business. Gabil has cows. He also buys little lambs to raise and then sells their meat at the local bazaar to earn money. Today Gabil has applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 1550-Azerbaijan New Manat. With this loan Gabil wants to buy more lambs for his business. For this help he says he is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and the lenders.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her mid 30s, is single with three children, two of whom go to school, and the other one is still small. She has been running a charcoal business for four years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jamila's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her charcoal stock, and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will also use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of making her family progressive. 

Jamila will share this loan with her loan group, "Muungano - Beach," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Donai Group

texts.es: Dúo Danaí, integrado por doña Leona de 45 años casada con 4 hijos dos estudian y 2 ya trabajan, su esposo trabaja como agente de seguridad para una empresa, doña Leona se dedica a la venta de refacciones por las tardes en el mercado Municipal, desde hace 20 años, también se dedica a la agricultura solo cosechan en tiempos de invierno junto con su esposo, su sueño es que su negocio crezca y así mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Doña Leona is a member of Dúo Danaí . She is 45 years old, married and has four children. Two already work. Her husband works as a security guard for a company.  Doña Leona sells snacks in the afternoon in the market, as she has done for 20 years. She also works in agriculture and she harvests in the winter months with her husband. Her dream is that the business grows and she can improve her home.

loans.use: purchase merchandise to make snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Nowadays, life has become difficult due to the high cost of commodities and school fees. For this reason, Jessica aims to improve her small bakeshop in order to increase her income and support the education of her six children. She plans to prepare more kinds of recipes, but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, she is requesting fa loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, milk and other ingredients needed in the bakeshop. She believes that when her loan will be granted, she will be able to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, margarine, milk and other ingredients needed in the bakeshop

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32 year old Joseph from Masvingo. He is married with three children, only one of which attends school. He also cares for one other dependent. Joseph runs a fashion boutique business selling clothes, shoes and handbags. The business has been in operation for 6 years. He says the main challenges faced are stiff competition and delays at the boarder post. Joseph has requested a loan of $600 to purchase skirts, jeans, sneakers, handbags and shoes for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him an increase in disposable income hence an improvement in his family's welfare. In the future Joseph plans to open shops and also venture into transport business.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, jeans, sneakers, handbags, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos de 13,10y 6 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la comunidad de Rumi Loma perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Reyna del Cisne , la cual se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Rumi loma a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda, está conformada por 10 socios, los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.
Elsa es agricultora, se dedica al comercio de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar más vacas. La compra la realiza cada 8 días en Guaranda y la venta la realiza en Guanujo en la plaza cada semana. Sus metas son: salir adelante con su familia, e incrementar su negocio. Su desafío son las enfermedades de los animales. En su tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Elsa is 30 years old, married and has 3 children aged 6, 10 and 13. She lives with her husband and children in the community of Rumi Loma which belongs to the Guaranda Canton, Bolivar Province. She is a member of the "Reyna del Cisne" communal bank which is located in the community of Rumi Loma, 30 minutes from the Guaranda regional office. It is composed of 10 members who are farmers.

Elsa is a farmer. She works in the cattle business. She is asking for a loan to buy more cattle. Buying is done every 8 days in Guaranda and sales happen in the plaza of Guanujo every week. Her goals are to get ahead with her family and expand her business. Her challenge is the animals getting sick. In her spare time she likes to arrange the house and she really likes carnival.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 46 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Clotilde's business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Clotilde is taking out a bridge loan to restart her buying and selling of recycled materials business.

She has requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to restart recycled materials business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Clotilde is committed to rebuild, and in the future, would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to restart her business after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 48 years old, lives in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has been married since 1991 and has one son and three daughters. One of his children is an accountant, two attend school and another one is hired to work in chicken farming.  

Thy and his wife are rice farmers and they also raise cows at home. Thy wants to maintain his rice farm by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide. So, he deiced to apply for a loan and he will use a part of the loan to pay for the plowing fee.  

Photo: Thy is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn is 24 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Helyn works very hard to provide for them.
