Helyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Helyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future, Helyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale in order to provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in his local area.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Her business was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. To restart her business, Elisa requested a 5,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries for resale.

Elisa has been in this business for two years now. With your help, Elisa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. 

In the future, Elisa would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 22 years old and single. She works to help her parents. Ethel's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ethel is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Ethel has requested 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to restart the store. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. Ethel is committed to rebuild and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 70 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Aurelia works very hard to provide for them.

Aurelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Aurelia has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old, married and has six children.  

Alicia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Alicia is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has been in farming for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Alicia is committed to rebuild her business. In future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.ru:
Геннадий — предприниматель из Мелитополя. Он торгует женской и мужской одеждой на выездных рынках за пределами города, есть торговые точки в Днепрорудном. Опыт работы Геннадия составляет 17 лет. Товар, который он реализует, очень неоднотипный.
В этот раз Геннадий планирует сделать сезонную закупку на сумму в 30 000 гривен и приобрести весенне-летнюю одежду, солнцезащитный очки для реализации со своих точек. Геннадий очень трудолюбивый, ответственный работник, бизнес ведет умело, всегда правильно распределяет финансовые средства.
texts.en: Gennadyi is an entrepreneur from Melitopol.  He sells women's and men's clothing at a number of different markets outside the city, he even has shops in the city of Dniprorudne.  His has 17 years of experience in this trade, which is not trivial since he sells a variety of merchandise.  Currently, Gennadyi wants to purchase some new merchandise for the season for 30,000 hryvni.  He plans to get the spring and summer clothing as well as sunglasses, to be sold at his shops.  Gennadyi is a very hard-working and a responsible man who conducts his business with skill and who always allocates his working capital in the most beneficial way.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer clothing merchandise and sunglasses to increase his turnover

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Esta carta tiene como motivo pedirles una ayuda educativa para Karina Andrea una adolescente que tiene muchas ganas de estudiar,de progresar y salir adelante  para asi ayudarle  a la familia, ella acaba de ingresar  al instituto campo alto, a estudiar auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos, carece de recursos económicos para una universidad, por esto se inscribió en este instituto, pues se lo recomendaron y le dijeron que era muy bueno, ella con las ganas de estudiar puede proyectarse y tener un buen nivel académico, pero como comento los recursos son un poco limitados, por eso recurre a ustedes con la esperanza de poder acceder al beneficio del convenio  kiva, pues los sueños son convertirse en una excelente auxiliar de servicios farmacéuticos y conseguir un buen empleo
texts.en: This letter is to ask for help with the education of Karina Andrea. She is an adolescent who has a lot of desire to study, progress and get ahead in order to help her family. She entered Campo Alto to study to be a Pharmaceutical assistant. She does not have the resources to attend university so she registered here at Campo Alto as it was recommended and she was told that it was good. She can with her desire to study stand out here and achieve a good academic standing but she comments that her economic resources are somewhat limited. So she has come to you with the hopes of getting a loan from Kiva. Then she can achieve her dream of becoming an excellent Pharmaceutical assistant and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Bweranyange Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Donozio, age 35, is married with two children who are 5 years old and 3 years old. He is in charge of taking care of them; one is attending school. 

Donozio is a farmer and has been practicing farming, since 2002, as his major source of income. He is also engaged in the sale of produce as a supplementary source of income.

Donozio has approached Ugafode for a loan through the group to use in his farming activities, such as mulching the plantation, buying pesticides and also buying more produce.

His dreams are to build a good home in which to house his family and also to improve his family's standard of living. However, his main challenges are limited capital and bad weather that sometimes affect his farming projects. 

He is confident these challenges will soon be history with the financial aid from Ugafode and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy mulch and produce.

loans.name: Kupha

texts.en: Kupha is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal Region of Kenya. For the past 2 years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Diana Julieth

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de Diana Julieth, Quien tiene 34 años de edad, cuando tenía 2 meses de edad los padres viajaron a la ciudad de Neiva donde fue criada hasta los 13 años, luego vivieron en la ciudad de Bogotá ya que el padre por ser un Inspector de Obras Civiles le han asignado vivir en varias partes de Colombia, la madre es ama de casa y Diana es la tercera hija de 4 en total.
Radicados en la ciudad de Bogotá, la matricularon en un colegio público donde realizo todo el estudio de Primaria y parte del bachillerato, ya que la culminación del bachillerato lo hizo en la ciudad de Cali, donde estaba radicada la hermana mayor quien la ha apoyado para realizar los estudios correspondientes. Allí se graduó y cumplió la mayoría de edad, en Cali empezó a trabajar como vendedora en un almacén de ropa.
Regreso a la ciudad de Bogotá junto a  los padres, comenzó a trabajar como mercaderísta, con los ingresos recibidos  apoyaba a los padres en los gastos requeridos mensualmente.
En este medio de trabajo conoció a Alexander con el que tuvo una relación y de allí nació un hijo llamado Juan Diego, a pesar de la corta edad y siendo madre le tocaba esforzarse más  para poder  ayudar a la familia, desafortunada mente la pareja falleció cuando apenas el hijo tenía 3 años de nacido, así que le toco superar esta difícil situación, pero gracias a  los padres que siempre la han apoyado logro salir adelante.

Luego de un tiempo conoció al compañero sentimental con el que vive actualmente y con el que tienen un hijo llamado Sergio, la  pareja hoy día se encuentra laborando en una empresa donde  fabrican ropa quirúrgica, por esta razón ella quiso vincularse  con todo lo relacionado al área de salud y con motivos de seguir superándose se encuentra en el momento estudiando en CAMPO ALTO como técnico en Higienista en salud oral, de esta forma verse proyectada en un futuro como profesional en carreras similares como la mecánica dental o la odontología si fuera posible. 
El proyecto es aportar económicamente al núcleo familiar para alcanzar un nivel de superación personal y profesional.
El anhelo es llegar a tener un consultorio odontológico propio y poder surgir como empresaria.
El Lugar donde realizo las prácticas fue muy bueno, fue donde le enseñaron y acompaño durante todo el proceso de aprendizaje, de allí la labor que más le gusto fue el aprender e interactuar en un procedimiento de conductos.
Finalmente Diana Julieth es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de superarse, quiere poder darles  a los hijos una estabilidad de vida adecuada, por lo tanto está feliz por empezar a hacer los sueños realidad, de este modo la ayuda que le ofrece kiva es bastante buena ya que el valor de las cuotas reducen un poco y ella puede colaborar un poco más en los gastos que tiene en el hogar.
texts.en:
This is the story of Diana Julieth. She is 34 years old. When she was 2 months old, her parents travelled to the city of Neiva, where she was raised until she was 13. Later they lived in the city of Bogotá. Since her father was an Civil Works inspector, he has been assigned to work in different parts of  Colombia. Her mother is a housewife and Diana is the third child of 4.  

Living in the city of Bogotá, they registered her in the public school where she did primary school and a part of high school. She finished high school in the city of Cali, where her older sister lived. She has supported her in her studies. She graduated from there and became and adult. In Cali she started to work as a salesperson in a clothing store. She returned to the city of Bogotá with her parents and started to work as a merchant. With the income she received, she helped her parents with the monthly expenses.  

Through this work, she met Alexander, with whom she had a relationship and a child was born named Juan Diego, despite her young age and being a mother, she worked harder to be able to help her family. Unfortunately, he spouse died when her son was barely three years old, so she had to overcome that difficult situation. Thanks to her parents, who have always supported her, she was able to get ahead.    

After a time, she met her romantic partner with whom she lives now. They have a son named Sergio. Her spouse is now working at a business where they make surgical clothing. That is why she wanted to be connected to everything related to the area of health. In order to get ahead, she is now studying at CAMPO ALTO to be a dental hygienist. In this way, she sees herself in the future as a professional in a similar profession, such as a dental  technician, if possible.

The project is to financially support her family to get ahead personally and professionally. Her wish is to have her own dentist office and get ahead as a businesswoman.

The place where she did her training is very good. They taught her and accompanied her during the whole learning process. What she liked the most there was learning and interacting in behavioral conduct. Finally, Diana Julieth is an enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead. She wants to be able to give her children enough stability in life. Therefore, she is happy to begin to make her dreams come true. In this way, the help offered by Kiva is very good, since the payments are reduced a little and she can help out a little more with the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es: La  Señora Dina Elizabeth de 54 años de edad quien tiene 2 hijos se dedica a la venta de helados  y dulces típicos desde hace 16 años,  solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos (azúcar, pasas, miel, leche, nuez, canela, etc.) para elaboración y venta de granola ya ella desea implementar la venta de granola por mayor en su negocio y sus clientes solicitan con frecuencia  ya que ella lo elabora por menor cantidad y lo distribuye a sus clientes su sueño es poder implementar una tienda de dulces típicos y poder distribuir todos sus  productos a nivel nacional.
texts.en: Dina Elizabeth is 54 years old and has two children. She has made a living by selling ice cream and traditional sweets for sixteen years. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies (sugar, raisins, honey, milk, nuts, cinnamon, etc.) to make and sell granola because she wants to start selling granola wholesale in her business. Her customers request it frequently, as she makes it in smaller quantities and distributes it to them. Her dream is to be able to open a store selling traditional sweets and to be able to distribute all of her products at a national level.

loans.use: to buy material to make traditional sweets

loans.name: Vetiliana

texts.en:
Vetiliana is a mother of three who operates a piggery, raising pigs for sale. Having been three years in the business, she earns well for the family. She also sells pork in her village during weekends and other special ocasions in order to earn additional profits. 

Vetiliana borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to purchase feed in order to sustain her business and provide her children with a better education. She is the sole provider for her family and her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business, as well as her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 44-year-old married mother of five children who has been working as a tailor since 20 years ago.

In 1999, she started her own business. At the beginning she had slight problems while starting her business, since she had only one tailoring machine and she had to purchase an extra updated one, but her financial situation wasn't good enough to develop her business at that time. 

Diana had to take care of her beloved family, because her husband had a certain health problem, which forced her to work harder, and at the same time, she was capable of developing her business and increasing her income through buying a new tailoring machine that helped her a lot in her business development.

Today Diana is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to provide her son with the necessary medication for his eyes, which is the most important thing she aims to do at this time, in addition to making sure that she can reply to almost all of her customers' needs to support her beloved family.

She hopes to keep on developing her business in a well managed way to make sure that she can reply to almost all of her customers' needs and develop her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To provide her son with the necessary medication for his eyes

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita has been selling rice and corn grits in the market for more than four years. She earns well from this and her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid with her generated revenue. The business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. To gain more sales, she has taken a new loan to obtain additional rice and corn variants to sell. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Marita expects to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to obtain additional rice and corn variants to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 24-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 4 years. He describes himself to be future oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a semi-urban area, and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of shoes. His business goal is to open a shoe store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a bigger shop. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elsa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Elsa has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lynne

texts.en: Lynne works hard to support her family. She is married and has a beauty salon in the Philippines. Lynne has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional beauty supplies for her salon. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lynne would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Encarnacion is 70 years old and married with ten children. She works very hard to provide for them. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Encarnacion has been in this business for 19 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Fe has been in this business for 21 years now. In the future, Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additonal boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose works hard to support her family. Mary Rose has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Mary Rose requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) bridge loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Mary Rose has been in this business for three years now. With your help, Mary Rose will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Mary Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc., to restart her business after Super Typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is 30 years old and she lives with her nice family in Kapan city in Syuink region. She has a higher education and she is a perfect specialist of Armenian Language and Literature. She works at the Kapan city school as a teacher, and, at the same time, she has several pupils to whom she gives paid private courses of Armenian Language and Literature and prepares them for the entrance examination. 

Ida’s eldest daughter goes to kindergarten and her mother-in-law takes care of Ida's youngest daughter, who is a year old. Ida’s husband is also employed (he is a storekeeper at the very famous candy company in Kapan branch) and together they manage to earn a living for their family.
 
Ida wants greatly to buy several new books connected with her specialty and a computer, which is of great need nowadays, but she cannot allow herself to incur such a big expense. She hopes that Kiva lenders will help her in this situation.

loans.use: to buy several new books connected with her specialty and a computer.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy (in the photo), age 49, lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with four sons: two have full-time employment, one is a teacher and another attends school. 

Channy sells coffee from home. She sells black coffee, black coffee with ice, and coffee with milk and ice. She is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her son to get work, because Channy’s son commutes to work by taking a taxi or asking his neighbor for a ride sometimes.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his car wash service

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 43 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nancy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. Nancy has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 52 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Merly has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like rice, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

Merly has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Merly would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like rice, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Rona Jean

texts.en:
Rona Jean is 39 years old and married with two children.

Rona Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rona Jean has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Rona Jean aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is a 27-year-old married man who has settled in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, together with his child, to earn his living. Over the past four years, Randy has been able to run his retail store that absolutely met the market's primary demands. The business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Randy's previous business loan was successfully repaid with his generated revenue. Randy recently took out a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods in order to increase sales. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Randy expects an increase in sales so as to expand his business and improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Dúo Maravillas De Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Maravillas de Dios La señora María Isabel de 40 años de edad, originaria del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez,  madre de 3 hijos  comprendidos entre las  edades de 17,15,12, doña Isabel por varios años se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales, cerdos y pollos, patos y gansos, ella compra pollos pequeños y los engorda en un tiempo de uno y dos meses,  también compra cerdos y los desparasita, y engorda y si nadie se los compra ella los destaza en su domicilio, quedándole así una  mejora ganancia, el anhelo de doña Isabel   es que su hijo mayor este año termine sus estudios de diversificado, por lo que este año tiene muchos gastos, pero también tiene muchas ganas de seguirle poniendo empeño a su  negocio, por lo que requiere de capital para trabajar,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
The "Maravillas de Dios" Duo

María Isabel is 40 years old and from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez. She is the mother of three children aged 17,15 and 12. For many years, Isabel has made a living by raising animals: pigs, chickens, ducks and geese. She bought small chickens and fattened them within a period of a month or two. She also buys pigs, deworms and fattens them, and if no one buys them she butchers them at home, thus having better earnings. Isabel wants her older son to finish his high school studies this year, so she has a lot of expenses this year. But she also has a great desire to keep putting effort into her business, so she requires capital to work. She is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, 55 years old, is married and blessed with four children. She helps her husband to gain income through buying and reselling soft brooms and rattan products within the local community. Joyce aims to improve the business and increase her income to sustain her family's necessities. Having inadequate capital, Joyce is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more stock of soft brooms, baskets and other rattan products to sell. She is hoping her loan request will be granted to enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of soft brooms, baskets and other rattan products to sell

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en: Ilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Ilyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Ilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es: Juan tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Toda su vida ha trabajado como albañil y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Juan desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que como se puede apreciar en la fotografía habita en condiciones muy humildes y poco a poco va mejorando dado que no puede hacerlo todo al mismo tiempo. Comenzará mejorando el techo ya que es el más deteriorado y no se siente seguro por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en: Juan is 43 years old and lives in a house he owns with his life companion. He has worked as a stone mason for his entire life and this is how he makes a living and sustains his household. Juan wants to improve the conditions of his home; as you can see in the photograph, he lives in very humble conditions. Little by little he has been improving his home, given that he can't do everything at once. He will start improving the roof, as it is the most deteriorated part of the house and he doesn't feel safe. He has therefore made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying wood and galvanized sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy wood and galvanized sheet metal to repair the roof of his home

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is a single entrepreneur who has been operating a motorcycle transportation business while working at a private company to earn a living.  When he's in his office to work, he has his tenant run the transportation service. 

Brian has requested a loan from GDMPC micro finance to cover the cost of a motor repair. In the future, he wants to earn a better living with his family.

loans.use: to cover the cost ofa  motor repair

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima previously accessed a 33,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more used-but-still-good clothes for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Naima would like to apply for another 38,000 PHP loan to buy more used-but-still-good clothes for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Naima's business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Naima hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family always sticks together. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more used, but still good, clothes for her business.

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
Musharaf was born in 1960. She is married and has adult children. Her husband works for an organization. Mushahraf lives with her family in a rural area. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 21 years. She is a very hardworking woman and she has great experience in animal husbandry. Musharaf feeds cows and sheep. She is the main feed keeper of her family. 

Musharaf is going to repair her house, as her house is in a bad condition, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood and paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale in order to provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.en:
Zumrat is 46 years old. She is widowed. Her husband died some years ago, and she is the only provider for her three children. Zumrat has been busy with selling dried fruits more than 15 years. She sells dried fruits in a local market. Zumrat is a very kind and sociable woman. Thanks her hard work and good attitude to customers, she has her own regular customers. 

Zumrat’s son does have a job in Tajikistan. He wants to go to Russia for finding a job. He asked his mother to help him. Zumrat is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy an air ticket to Russia for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket to Russia for her son to find work

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman, who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman, with six children, five in school and one underage. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Fatuma operates a business of selling goats. She sells them to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  With the loan she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La Srta. Laura es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de esto podrá cumplir con su sueño de poder ayudar a las demás personas. Laura es una joven muy luchadora y que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Laura  is a very responsible person who is dedicated to her studies and her family. She aspires to be a good professional and continue studying and serving people.
She is studying the career of nursing and in this way she will be able to complete her dream of being able to help other people. Laura is a very hardworking young woman and wants to get ahead in life.
She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in her payments and also to be able to cover her thesis expenses. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay student payments and expenses.

loans.name: Teofredo Jr.

texts.en:
Teofredo Jr. is studying in a university, taking up electrical Installation as a Mechanic. He is the third child among four siblings. 

Teofredo Jr. is very dedicated to his studies, and to him, family is the most precious thing in his life. His father is a private employee and his mother is a teacher.
He  requests this loan to pay the school tuition fees. His goal is to find a better job in the future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a bureau where she offers photocopying and typesetting. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are male and female. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy printing papers and other stationery. Her business goal is to have many outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy printing papers and other stationery

loans.name: Grace Marie

texts.en:
Grace previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for their personal, household, and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Grace dreams that her business will continue to flourish, and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Daisy has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old.  She is married and has eight children, one of whom is in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.  Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.  Erlinda has been in this business for forty years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
Aged 41 and a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sarorn is a married mother blessed with two kids. She earns a living via cassava farming and paid-working job which she has occupied for more than 10 years, earning about 26,700 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Sarorn and her co-borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) after a successful repayment of her original loan. Now, her living conditions are better than before. This cycle, she is the leader of her group. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation. She hopes that she can gain a good income which will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Margiolina

texts.en:
Margiolina is 67 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Margiolina has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Margiolina requested a 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

Margiolina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Margiolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 66 years old and widowed with seven children.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Betty has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from dressmaking.

Betty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rukoola Kbc Listener's Club Group

texts.en:
Lovina, aged 39 years, is married and has three children who are aged 16, 14, and 12 years. All of them attend school, She is in charge of paying their school fees and other basic needs.
Lovina is a produce dealer and she has been doing this since 2002 as her major source of income. She is also engaged in farming and has a maize milling machine that supplements their family income.
Lovina has approached Ugafode for loan of UGX.1,000,000 to invest in the produce business since the season is now on.
Her main challenges include limited capital to invest in her business and a bad road network that affects her ability to transport her merchandise on time.
Her dream is to buy a motorcycle that can help her in the transportation of her products to market areas.  She thus needs funding so that her business can go on well.  She commended Ugafode for promoting people's business and welfare.

loans.use: To buy produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia estudia y es ama de casa, ella comenta que sus padres están en el extranjero  y que ella vive con sus hermanos.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Notariado, y comenta que sus metas futuras son la de trabajar en lo que va ser su profesión, y también más adelante seguir estudiando  para poder seguir creciendo como persona y profesional.
Cynthia está agradecida por la oportunidad de estudiar que está recibiendo, y comenta que usará su préstamo en pagar su matrícula y también en poder pagar algunas cuotas.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a student and homemaker.  She says that her parents are living outside the country, and that she lives with her siblings.

Cynthia is studying to become a notary, and she states that her future goals are to work in what will be her profession, and also in the future to continue to study so that she can continue to grow both personally and professionally.

Cynthia is grateful for this opportunity to study, and she comments that she will use her loan to pay for her tuition and fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and fees

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merly is 31 years old, and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.  Merly is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with one child who is in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expense is food.

Hellen operates a bicycle spare part selling business. She cites price fluctuations as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts such as bicycle tires and engine parts for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts such as bicycle tires and engine parts for her business.

loans.name: Sokyen's Group

texts.en:
Sokyen is 37 and married. She is one of the breadwinners in a family which includes five kids. Currently, only four kids still rely on her as three of them are in school and the remaining oneis too young for school. The cassava farming is the only source of her family income and she has been occupied with it for for several years. 

This is the second microloan for Sokyen’s group consisting of two people with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle so it is better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is applying for 2,500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay labor fees for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield that will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay labor fees for her crop.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 45 years old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. The main sources of her income are from her occupation as a paid worker at a construction site. This is not the first loan for Sinat or for her joint borrower in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has utilized her past loan wisely to support her business as well as to stabilize her living conditions especially to provide decent food for her kids. 

For this cycle, she is a representative of her group. She is seeking for 2,000,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy construction materials to support her occupation. She hopes to gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to support her occupation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is a 27-year-old mother of one. She settled to earn her living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Over the past four years, Manilyn has been able to run her retail store that sells grocery goods in their village. With her generated revenues, her previous loan used in the business was successfully repaid.

Manilyn joined GDMPC to have  access to financial services. Her loan currently is intended to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With this, Manilyn expects an increase in sales so she can expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 22-year-old married man. He has one child who is five months old. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be failure of payment by customers. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to employ people to assist in the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have more sewing machines. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of fabric, threads and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Luom's Group

texts.en:
Luom, a resident from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, is 49 years old and a mother blessed with five children. The rest of her family relies on one and half hectare of rice cropping and her paid-working job. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years, earning about 16,700 KHR per day.  

Luom has been involved with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages. Luom is in her ninth cycle including this loan. The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has helped Luom to uplift her lifestyle so it is better than before. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield which will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en: Sokhim is 31 years old, married,  and is a villager from Kampong Cham province where her crops are grown. She grows paddy rice, rubber plantation, and cassava as the main source of income, which she has occupied for ages. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She and her fellow group leader are in their first cycle loan requesting an amount of 500,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Leah is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leah has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La señora  Lidia tiene 32 años y 2 hijos  de las edades de 8 y 5 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados en la misma zona por donde ella vive,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos como abarrote y papa para la elaboración de comida, la señora Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y el deseo que tiene es tener un restaurante propio donde pueda ofrecer variedad de platillos  a sus clientes así poder mejorar sus ingresos de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Señora Lidia is 32 years old and has two children who are 8 and 5. She makes a living my selling food from her point of sale that can be found in her neighborhood markets. The loan that she is asking for will be used to purchase supplies like groceries and potatoes to prepare food. Lidia is a hard working person and has years worth of experience. She is thankful to the institution for the support it has given her because it is the only income that supports her family. Her hope is to have her own restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers and to be able to earn more money from it to benefit her family.

loans.use: purchase supplies like groceries and potatoes to prepare food.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана родом из Мелитополя. Она держит кафе-бистро в районе одного из местных рынков, летом сезонно расширяет бизнес и для работы в Кирилловке. 
Светлана планирует вложить сумму в 30 000 гривен в пополнение товарного запаса и открытие сезонной точки в курортном городке Кирилловка на Азовском море. Она планирует реализовывать горячие обеды, напитки, мороженое и прочие продукты среди приезжих отдыхающих.
texts.en: Svetlana is from Melitopol.  She owns a café-bistro near one of the local marketplaces, and seasonally expands her business in the summer to the resort town of Kirillovka.  She's seeking a loan of 30,000 hryvnia to stock up on goods and set up her seasonal café in Kirillovka, planning on offering hot lunches, drinks, ice cream and other items to vacationing tourists there.

loans.use: stock her seasonal cafe with produce before summer

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and fuel. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang is 38 years old and a breadwinner in her family consisting of three children. To sustain her family, she raises pigs for resale as a single source of income. This business, which has occupied her since she was 20 years old, generates about 33,000 riels (KHR) per day. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed. She hopes this purchase will enable her to raise her pig healthily so she can get a good selling price.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.ru:
Татьяна живет в Мелитополе. Она торгует на местном рынке более 15 лет, продает товары для дома. У Татьяны свое торговое место и рядом располагается склад с товаром. 
Татьяне необходима сумма в 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать товарный запас изделий из пластмассы, а также приобрести мебель для ванной для последующей реализации. Более широкий ассортимент товара поможет Татьяне постепенно расширять свой бизнес и улучшать благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Tatiana lives in Melitopol. She has been working at the local market for over 15 years, selling household goods. She has her own sales stand and a storage facility nearby. Tatiana needs a loan of 30,000 UAH in order to stock up on plastic goods and also buy bathroom furniture for later resale. A wider assortment of goods will allow Tatiana to keep expanding her business and improving her family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase plastic goods

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso was born in the year 1974. She is a kind woman. Mehriniso is widowed and brings up her child alone. Mehriniso began her business after the death of her husband. She needed to support her child and make money. Mehriniso started her business selling candies and chocolates. She has her own selling place in a local market. Little by little with the passing of time she developed her business. 

Mehriniso is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy candies and chocolates so as to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates so as to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en:
Nasibakhon is a kind and smart woman who was born in 1967. She lives with her big family in the capital of Tajikistan, and she likes her country very much. Nasibakhon is a careful mother of 3 children. She also has a daughter-in-law and some grandchildren. Nasibakhon’s husband is a driver. 

Seven years ago, Nasibakhon began her own business as a sewer. She has her own workshop, located in the center of town, which is why she has a lot of clients. Nasibakhon needs a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS (Somoni) to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Milgian Esmelin

texts.es:
La joven Milgian es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 8 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. 
Milgian necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, leche, jugos, pan, manteca, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo; el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Milgian con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario y poder mejorar así la calidad de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
 Milgian espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero  del  2014
texts.en:
Miligan is a hardworking and responsible person who lives in a southern Honduras community with her family.  She has had a grocery store in her home for eight years

Milgian needs a loan to buy things like beans, rice, sugar, coffee, milk, juices, bread, lard, etc. for her store so she can continue working.  This represents a large part of her income.

Milgian hopes to increase her sales with the help of this loan and this will be very helpful to her because she doesn’t have the items that her customers request each day.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family through increased income.

Milgian expects to grow her business in the short term and be able to continue supporting her family and make sure her that her children receive an education so that they will have better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – February 2014

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
This is Renalyn. She is 32 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Oliver, an employee and is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Renalyn oversees and owns the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.  To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories, and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Renalyn hopes to have additional units of tricycles and dreams that her children will all finish school. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintenance for their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Savy, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is 26 years old and a married mother blessed with two kids. Her main sources of income are from rice cropping and the paid-working job at construction sites. Now she is able to earn up to 33,200 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Savy and the first time for the other borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped her to uplift her living conditions so they are better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield which will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosel works hard to support her family.

She has a photocopier business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosel  is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase school supplies and an additional photocopier for her photocopier business.

Rosel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and an additional photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her roof and install a cement floor.

loans.name: Kuokor

texts.en:
Kuokor, 53 years old, is married and has children. She sells fresh fish in Accra. Her customers are located at the Burma camp in Accra. 

This loan is Kuokor's fifth transaction with ID-Ghana. She will use the loan to buy two cartons of fish and distribute them to customers. Kuokor has requested this loan because she needs to serve some customers who have placed orders. Kuokor faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition in the area since there are several neighborhood fish sellers. She will use her profits to continue buying more fish so that she can increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fish to distribute to customers.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El señor Ariel tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte de pasajeros en una línea, a esta actividad se dedica desde hace 6 años, de esta manera genera sus ingresos, además los fines de semana presta servicios de amplificación y genera ingresos extras, muestra ser una persona responsable con muchas ganas de superarse, el señor tubo gastos inesperados ya que su pareja se puso delicada de salud y tubo algunas complicaciones, ahora solicita un crédito porque necesita realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo con el cual genera sus ingresos, y de esta manera lograra ofrecer un servicio mas eficiente y mantener su nivel de ingresos ademas de estabilizar su actividad económica, todo esto con el fin de satisfacer todas sus necesidades y velar por el bienestar de su familia sobre todo por sus hijos pequeños que están estudiando y tienen muchos requerimientos para seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Ariel is 26 years old and is not married but lives with his partner. They have two children who depend on their income. He makes a living by providing transport services for passengers with a company. He has worked in this business for more than six years, and in this way he earns an income. On the weekends he also provides amplification services and earns extra income. He has shown himself to be a responsible person with a great desire to overcome obstacles. 

Ariel had unexpected expenses, as his partner got sick and had some complications. Now he is asking for a loan because he needs to do maintenance on the vehicle with which he earns an income. In this way he manages to offer a more efficient service, to maintain his level of income, and to stabilize his business, all with the purpose of satisfying his family's needs and looking out for their well-being, above all for his small children who are studying and require a lot of things to keep improving.

loans.use: to do vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nurmon

texts.en: Nurmon, 52 years old, is married and has 4 children. He lives with his family in a village. Nurmon has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 6 years. He feeds 6 cows and 5 sheep and has a big cowshed. Nurmon earns additional income from growing agricultural products, such as watermelon, onions and wheat. Nurmon has 3 hectares of land. His wife, son and daughter-in-law help him to manage the business, which is the family's main source of income. Nurmon is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy 12 sheep for increasing working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy 12 sheep for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ruhsat

texts.en:
Ruhsat is 57 years old, hardworking, and dedicated to her own business. She is married and has two children. She is a farmer and has been raising cattle for the last four years. She chose this business because it is profitable and because cattle are in high demand. She sells cattle in a local market. Her husband actively helps her to raise the cattle.

As cattle are in high demand, Ruhsat wants to expand her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ngazi

texts.en: Ngazi is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be goal-oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a suitable place and his primary customers are both low- and middle-class customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to be able to supply in large scale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise his standards of living. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 34 years old. He is a father of three children between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. Valens sells different items in his business. Currently, he sells food and has spent three years in the business. With the loan, he would like to buy more potatoes, corn and beans for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more corn, beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia, 64 years old, owns and operates a farm. She has been raising pigs and selling meat in her village and she earns well from this. In order to purchase feed, Antonia borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit. She hopes to gain more revenue to cover daily expenditures and to improve the piggery to ensure a better income in the future

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Mdzara

texts.en: Mdzara appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan to purchase food ingredients, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and onions, for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and onions, for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.ru:
Карло женат, имеет одну дочь. Карло работает санитаром в больнице. Также у него есть дополнительный доход - Карло выращивает саженцы фруктовых деревьев и продает их; также он продает фрукты.

Карло с семьей проживает в собственном доме. Дом старенький, окна и двери не держат тепло, поэтому зимой уходит много денег на отопление. Карло хочет сделать ремонт в доме - вставить новые энергосберегающие окна, поменять двери, сделать небольшой ремонт внутри дома. Он уверен, что его обновленный дом будет не только теплее, но и красивее.
texts.en:
Karlo is married and has one daughter. Karlo works as a nurse assistant in a hospital. He also has an additional source of income: he grows fruit tree seedlings and resells them. He also sells fruits.

Karlo and his family live in their own house. The house is quite old, and the windows and doors do not provide enough isolation from the cold, which is why in winter a lot of money is spent on heating. Karlo would like to renovate his come: to install new energy-saving windows, to change the doors and make minor renovations inside. He is sure that, after his renovation, his home will be not only warmer but more attractive.

loans.use: to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en:
Davronjon was born in 1995. He is not married and lives with his parents. Davronjon is a student of the third course at the Technology University of Tajikistan. He studies at the Faculty of Economics. Davronjon studies well. He reads a lot of books. 

Davronjon’s parents do not have the opportunity to pay for his tuition. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Sann, age 53, is a farmer from Svay Leu district, Siem Reap province. She is married and is a responsible mother of five grown-up children. She makes a living by farming rice with her husband in their village and earns additional income by selling chopped wood. She has been involved in these two businesses for more than 20 years.

This will be her third loan with Hattha Kaksekar Limited and the first loan with Kiva. Sann would like to use the loan for the purchase of a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Sann will be able to gain access to clean energy, which is used to support household appliances, such as lights, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She is very thankful and is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store and to help with her children's educational expenses. Her business income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. Julieta and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Julieta would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better; more items to sell will result in better profit. Julieta's business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies with the group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 5 hijos de 35,30,28,25,20 años de edad, vive con su esposa en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Luis es agricultor, se dedica al comercio de cerdos y ganado, también se desempeña como albañil. Solicita el crédito para compra de ganado con lo cual espera aumentar su negocio. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana y la venta del producto cada 6 meses. Su meta es tener bienes materiales para sus hijos. Su desafío es que todo se realiza con esfuerzo. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar vóley, la costumbre que más le gusta es la fiesta de la Virgen el 8 de mayo.
texts.en:
Luis is 58 years old, married and has five children aged 35, 30, 28, 25 and 20. He lives with his wife in Manzanapamba, a community located in the Guaranda canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the communal bank Manzanapamba, which is composed of ten members from the community, who work in agriculture. They are located thirty minutes away from the regional office of Guaranda.

Luis works in agriculture. He sells pigs and cattle, but he also works as a mason. He is requesting a loan to buy animals to expand his business. He purchases in Guaranda every week, and sells every six months. His goal is to have more things for his children. He believes everything he does requires a big effort. During his free time he likes to play volleyball. His favorite tradition is the celebration in honor of the Virgin Mary [a very important figure in Christianity], on the 8th of May.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with one very young child. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Luvuno's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Luvuno has operated a maize sales business for the last year, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality is her major business challenge. Luvuno is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of maize for her business. Her hope is that her business does well so that she can venture into a large-scale cereals sales business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for her business

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru: Ольга замужем. У нее двое взрослых детей. Ольга работает поваром, а также ее семья выращивает овощи в теплице на продажу. Вместе с мужем она проживает в собственном доме. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту от КИВЫ Ольга смогла заменить окна в доме и сохранять тепло во время зимы. В этот раз Ольга просит предоставить ей кредит для замены мягкой мебели. Кредит поможет Ольге улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Olga is married and has two grown-up children.  She works as a chef, and also grows vegetables in a greenhouse to sell.  She and her husband live together in their own house.  Thanks to the last loan she received from Kiva, Olga was able to replace the windows in her house and thus better insulate her home for the winter.  This time around, Olga is seeking a loan to replace the sofas and easy chairs in her house.  This loan will help Olga improve her living conditions.

loans.use: improve her living conditions

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz, 33 years old, is married and has 3 children. He is a smart man. His mother is a teacher and his father works in an organization. Firuz was one of the best pupils in school, having graduated with a gold medal. After graduating from school, Firuz didn't have the opportunity to enter university and went to Russia to find a job. This year, he returned to Tajikistan and entered university. Now he is a student of the first course. Firuz is asking for a loan to pay for his education. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 6 hijos de 19,17,14,12,9,6 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Segundo es agricultor, siembra papas, habas, cebada, alverja, también se dedica a la venta de leche. Solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca de leche y así seguir adelante con su negocio. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana y la venta también es cada semana. Su meta es tener más terrenos. Su desafío es el trabajo y su esfuerzo. En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar, la costumbre que más le gusta son las fiestas de carnaval y año nuevo.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old, married, and has six children aged 19, 17, 14, 12, 9 and 6. He lives with his wife in Manzanapamba, a community located in the Guaranda canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the communal bank Manzanapamba, which is composed of ten members from the community who work in agriculture. They are located thirty minutes away from the regional office of Guaranda.

Segundo works in agriculture. He grows potatoes, barley and peas, and sells milk. He is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow in order to get ahead with his business. He makes his purchases every week and sells every week too. His goal is to buy more land. He works hard and with a lot of effort. During his free time, he likes to play sports. His favorite traditions are the carnival and New Year’s celebrations.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna earns a living from selling goods in her general store, while her husband does farming. For three years, Myrna has been earning well and improving the business. Her earnings go towards her children's education costs. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have higher returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman and the mother of four children from Sikatuna, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in furniture making for more than  5 years. 

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy more wood, plywood, nails and varnish to improve their furniture making business, thus augmenting their income. Moreover, Evelyn wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more wood, plywood, nails and varnish

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil, 38 years old, is married and has two sons. She started supporting herself by working at different hair salons as an apprentice when she was 14. Her husband worked at barber shops. To improve her situation, Serpil opened her own salon. She will use this loan to buy additional shades of hair dye, which will attract new customers. Her dream for the future is to be able to give her sons a good future and to support them to stand on their own feet.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Serpil Hanım, 38 yaşında evli ve 2 erkek çocuk sahibi.   14 yaşından beri çeşitli kuaför dükkanlarında çırak olarak çalışarak ,ayaklarının üzerinde durmuş.  Kendi gibi eşi de erkek kuaförü olan Serpil hanım daha sonra kendisini ilerleterek kendi dükkanını açmış.   Mikro krediden alacağı kredi ile dükkanına saç boyası alarak renk çeşidini ve müşteri potansiyelini arttırmak istiyor.   İleride ki hayali ise 2 oğluna iyi bir gelecek verebilmek ve ayaklarının üzerinde durabilmeleri için destek olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy additional shades of hair dye

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
The two women in the photo are part of the group called Noyaa (which means progress), and they both live in the same neighborhood.
They sell gari, vegetable, palm oil, rice and beans.

Rebecca (seen in the photo standing on the left) is the group's representative. She is 57 years old and single with adult children.

Rebecca has been selling vegetables, palm oil, rice and beans at her residence for eight years. This allows her to contribute to the expenses of her family in addition to her own personal expenses. She buys her vegetables, palm oil, rice and beans at the market in Ghana.

Rebecca and the other member of her group would like to improve their businesses, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, ID-Ghana. The previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buys her vegetables, palm oil, rice and beans at the market in Ghana.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru: Иван владеет небольшим кафе, расположенным в центре рынка. Ему очень нравится этот бизнес и этот чувствуют его постоянные клиентны, которых у него достаточно много. Иван уже прользовался КИВА кредитами и считает их выгодными для своего бизнеса. В этот раз Иван просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 22,000 гривен на покупку оборудования, а именно кофеварки, а также закупки товара. Иван надеется привлечь больше клиентов в свое кафе и увеличить свой доход.
texts.en: Ivan has a small cafe located in the center of the market. He really likes this business and has quite enough loyal customers. Ivan has already used KIVA loans and considers them useful for his business. This time, Ivan is requesting a loan in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy equipment, specifically a coffee maker, as well as merchandise. Ivan hopes to attract more customers to his cafe and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a coffeemaker and merchandise.

loans.name: Khursandoy

texts.en:
Khursandoy was born in 1983. She is a kind woman. 

Khursandoy is a teacher. She has worked at a local school in her region as a teacher more than 13 years. She earns additional income from growing agricultural products as her teaching salary is small. Khursandoy grows grapes and vegetables. Her husband and father-in-law help her with managing the business. Khursandoy wants to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where she grows grapes, but she has no money to do so. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives with her husband, father-in-law and 4-year-old child. Her husband is a taxi driver and her father-in-law is in construction.
