Anahit herself has been involved in a retail business: she sells cosmetics and receives different orders from her clients in Gyumri. Anahit also sells her products in neighboring villages and earns income for her family's well-being. 

Now, she has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of supplies (cosmetics) for reselling to clients. The loan will be a great support to Anahit's small business and she waits for lenders' support. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (cosmetics) for reselling to clients.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is 23 and she lives in the beautiful city of Dilijan. She lives there with her mother. Ani has higher education and the specialty of artist. She works at the Dilijan Geological Museum Gallery as a senior research fellow and guide. As she says, her work is very interesting as many pupils and students visit this gallery and she tells all of them the most important and interesting things about geology; however, for all this she receives little salary. Her mother is also employed and their small family’s low income solves only very urgent and everyday needs.

Ani wants to make a great surprise for her mother. She wants by the help of this loan to buy a refrigerator for her mother. She hopes to make her happy.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for her mother to make her happy

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called "God is Able". They are married women who live with their husbands and children in nuclear families. They are, on average, 46 years old, and have two children. These two women live in the same neighborhood and are friends. They sell secondhand clothing, towels, yams, fish and chicken. In order to increase their working capital, the group has decided to work with field partner, ID-Ghana, on their sixth group loan.

Esther (on the left of the photo) is well-known for selling secondhand clothing and towels. She will use this loan to buy a half bale of clothing and towels from Accra. She will then sell the clothing and towels from door-to-door. Esther hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested into her business and used to provide for her children's smaller expenses.

loans.use: To buy a half bale of clothing and towels from Accra

loans.name: Rahbarzhon

texts.en:
Rahbarzhon is 62 years old and married with three children. Being a responsible mother, she works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs. She is dedicated to her animal husbandry business, growing cows and sheep. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning until late evening for 12 years.

Rahbarzhon would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni (TJS) to purchase cattle for increasing working capital. She hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject her loan, and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.en: Davronjon is a hardworking man who was born in 1989. Some years ago, he began his own business selling DVD disks in a store located in the center of his town. He is going to increase working capital and, in this way, develop his business. Davronjon's parents are poor people and he is the main provider for the family. He is not yet married. Davronjon is asking for a loan of 4,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy DVD disks. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy DVD disks to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Meet Ruth, a farmer and the mother of 4 children. She lives in the Nyamira area of Nyanza Kenya, which is a primary banana producing area. Ruth loves farming and, more especially, crop farming. Her primary income sources are eggs and a variety of crops, including tea. Ruth's biggest challenge is tea picking because of the lack of laborers.

Ruth chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they work closely with farmers and they also train them. During the training, she learned proper loan repayment. This loan will enable Ruth to purchase a water tank to store water for her crops, thus making her production increase, which will yield more profit. The income Ruth gets will enable her to take care of her family's needs easily.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose Manuel es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Juan Manuel es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive en una casa propia y se dedica a manejar un taxi, también recibe una pensión.
esta solicitando el préstamo para construir un cuarto en su casa ya que el comenta que su familia ha crecido y no tienen suficiente espacio.
El comenta que le gusta ser muy cumplido con el pago de sus créditos y pedir solo lo que necesita. 
El tiene un taxi que maneja de lunes y domingo, es sus descansos intermedios le gusta ir a desayunar y a comer en su casa.
Para Juan Manuel sus principales logros es sacar y darle estudios a sus 5 hijos y haber construido su casa, ahora su reto es construir unos cuartos para que su familia tenga más espacio.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story.

Juan Manuel is married and has 5 children. He lives in his own home and makes his living driving a taxi. He also receives a pension.

He is applying for this loan to build a room in his house, since he says his family has grown and they don't have enough space. He comments that he likes to be very responsible with his payments and ask for only what he needs.

He has a taxi that he drives from Monday to Sunday. During his breaks, he likes to go have breakfast and eat lunch at home.

For Juan Manuel, his most significant successes are educating his 5 children and having built his house. Now his challenge is to build some rooms so that his family can have more space.

loans.use: to make housing improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing cosmetic services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, sodas and snacks.

loans.name: Florissa

texts.en:
Florissa previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and maintain their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for with children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add into her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. She will also use the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florissa hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  She can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. Estela earns a living by selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her place like rice cakes and others.

Estela is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients to sell like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil and peanuts. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more. Estela dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like sugar, flour, milk, cooking oil and peanuts

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is married and has 4 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Hawa's greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Hawa operates a stall, selling groceries and vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. Hawa dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

Hawa will use this loan to buy tomatoes, green vegetables, onions and potatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green vegetables, onions and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 41 years old, and she lives in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. Lida has a daughter who is a student of Medical College in the paid division, and in the future she will work as a nurse. Lida’s son is in the army now. Lida and her husband work very hard to earn their living. Lida is a tailor-worker at a private workshop. She also takes some orders for sewing dresses at her house, trying somehow to make her family income bigger since the expenses are high, plus there is the additional strain of their daughter’s educational fees. Lida is very worried about their financial condition since her husband’s work is seasonal. He is a construction worker, and for two months already he has had no work because of the cold winter. 

Lida needs this loan since it is expensive to pay for her daughter’s second semester tuition fee. She greatly hopes to be supported by generous Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s second semester tuition fees

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a hardworking woman who is doing well in her business. Here again she is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy more fish for sale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Eunice`

texts.en: Eunice is a widow with 4 children whose ages range from 15 to 30 years. She describes herself as an achiever. For the past 10 years, Eunice has operated a poultry farm, selling chickens. Her business is located in an area with ready market and her primary customers are schools and hotels. Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chicken feed. Eunice's business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will achieve her business goals. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 25 years old and she lives in Yerevan city. She is married and is the young mother of a pretty, nice girl. Before becoming a mother, Marina used to work at the municipality, but since her daughter was born, she has stayed at home and taken care of her. Marina's husband is a very clever and hardworking person who works and does everything to provide his young family with good living conditions. He distributes meat from villages to city supermarkets. As Marina says, his work is very tense and hard since he is always in a hurry and drives long distances in order to bring good, healthy and fresh meat on time to the shops that give him orders. 

Marina decided to help her husband and she passed courses for doing makeup and manicures. For the first period while their child is small, Marina plans to work at home. She already has many loyal customers, but she has a lack of good, high quality tools and makeup and manicure materials. Marina is asking for a loan in order to buy makeup materials and tools. She greatly hopes that this loan will help her to develop her start-up business and help her husband to solve their family's financial problems.

loans.use: to buy makeup materials and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 29-year-old married woman from the Kvareli district. She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband is a private worker who brings firewood from the forest and sells it. This activity is seasonal, and he earns a small income that is hardly enough for meeting their basic needs, especially since they have three children. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no significant source of income and live under the poverty line. Because of the above-mentioned situation, Maia is not able to receive credit from the local financial providers for starting business.  

Maia's request has now been approved within the framework of Kiva and Credo, so she is able to use this startup loan for starting a business trading in  used clothing. The loan of 300 USD will help her to purchase a stock of goods which she would sell from her house among the villagers. Maia thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is the only business of this kind in the area. After the start of trading, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. Maia will be thankful to lenders for giving her a chance to make a better life for her children and develop her own business.

loans.use: To start trading in used clothing

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
As Artur thought, his deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon will be continuous for him and he has now decided to take one more loan from Kiva. 

Artur lives in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region, with his wife and two daughters. He is a driver who uses his own car to drive people anywhere they order, even to Georgia or to the Russian Federation. Driving these kinds of long distances makes Artur feel a great responsibility, which is why he always keeps his car in order and clean. His regular customers trust him very much and Artur has worked for them for many years.

Artur is asking for his second Kiva loan since it is time to do some repairs on his car. He also wants to decrease his expenses, so he wants to settle a gas gallon to replace using petrol for his car, as gas will be much cheaper than petrol.

loans.use: to do some repairs on his car

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 53 years old and lives in Teshie, Accra, which is one of the commercial areas in Ghana. Comfort is single with adult children who take care of themselves. She has been selling smoked fish for the past 17 years. She started this business with money given to her by one of her daughters, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it produces a good profit. 

Comfort is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to smoke and sell to customers. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Segundo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Segundo es agricultor, siembra papas, también se dedica a la venta de leche. Solicita el crédito para compra de una vaca con lo que desea aumentar la producción de leche. La compra la realiza en Riobamba cada 15 días y vende cada 6 meses en Guaranda. Su meta es mejorar sus posibilidades económicas y obtener una caja para hacer quesos prensados. Su desafío es la lluvia y la ceniza volcánica. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo is 33 years old, married, and has a 3 year old son.  He lives with his parents in the Manzanapamba community in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolivar.  He is a member of the Manzanapamba community bank, which is made up of 10 members from the same community who work in agriculture.  It is located 30 minutes from the operations office in Guaranda.  

Segundo is a farmer.  He plants potatoes.  He also sells milk.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a cow to increase his milk production.  He makes purchases in Riobamba every two weeks and makes sales every six months in Guaranda.  His goal is to improve his financial possibilities and buy a box to make pressed cheeses.  His biggest challenges are the rain and volcanic ash.  

In his free time, he likes to play sports and his favorite custom is Carnival.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
María es agricultora, siembra papas, maíz, trigo, cebolla, también se dedica al comercio de animales. Solicita el crédito para compra de cerdos y pollos, con lo cual desea incrementar su negocio. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana y la venta se la realiza cada seis meses. Sus metas son: ver feliz a su familia y aumentar su negocio. Su desafío es que los remedios para los animales son caros. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta es la fiesta de la Virgen Lourdes de Fátima la cual se realiza el 8 de Mayo.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old, married and has an 8-year-old son. She lives with them in the Manzanapamba community, part of the Guaranda Canton, in Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Manzanapamba communal bank, which consists of 10 members from the same community who work in agriculture. It is located 30 minutes away from the Guaranda operational office.

María works as a farmer, growing potatoes, corn, wheat and onions, as well as selling animals. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs and chickens, with which she hopes to increase her business. Her challenge is that animal medications are expensive. Purchases are made once a week in Guaranda and sales every six months.

Her goals are to see her family happy and increase her business. In her free time she likes to practice sport, and her favorite tradition is the Feast of Our Lady of Fátima, which takes place on May 8.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has five school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Asha's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Asha has operated a business selling khangas (brightly colored patterned cloth, commonly worn by women as a wrap or scarf), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. Asha plans to use this loan to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 1 año de edad, vive con sus hijos en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
María es agricultora, siembra papas, habas, cebada, cebolla, también se dedica al comercio de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca, y así mejorar su calidad de vida. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana y la venta del producto cada tres meses. Su meta es que sus hijos tengan una buena salud y mejorar sus cultivos. Su desafío son las heladas y los vientos. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar y ver televisión, la costumbre que más le gusta son las fiestas de mayo.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old. She is single and has 2 children, ages 13 years and 1 year. She lives with her children in the Manzanapamba community, which is part of Guaranda canton, Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Manzanapamba community bank, which is made up of 10 members who are from the same community and who make their living in agriculture. She is located 30 minutes from Guaranda's central office.

María is a farmer. She grows potatoes, broad beans, barley and onions, and also sells animals. She is applying for this loan to buy a cow, so she can improve her quality of life. She makes her purchases in Guaranda every week, and sells her product every three months.

Her goal is for her children to be healthy and to improve her crops. Her challenges are the freezes and the winds.

In her free time, she likes to rest and watch TV. The custom she enjoys the most are the May festivals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Segundo Reimundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 7 hijos de 25, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12, 8 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en la comunidad Manzanapamba perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Manzanapamba está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad los cuales se dedican a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la oficina operativa Guaranda.
Segundo es agricultor, siembra papas, cebolla, cebada, también se dedica a la venta de leche. Solicita el crédito para compra de una vaca para así solventar el ingreso de la familia. La compra la realiza en Guaranda cada semana y la venta también es cada semana. Su meta es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, y aumentar el ganado. Su desafío son los desastres naturales. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, la costumbre que más le gusta son las danzas en las que participa la comunidad.
texts.en:
Segundo is 46 years old, married, and has seven children who are 25, 22, 19, 17, 15, 12, and 8 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the community of Manzanapamba in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolivar.  He is a member of the Manzanapamba community bank, which is made up of 10 members from the same community who work in agriculture.  It is located 30 minutes from the operations office in Guaranda.

Segundo is a farmer who plants potatoes, onions, and barley.  He also sells milk.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a cow to increase his family's income.  He makes purchases and sales in Guaranda every week.  His goals are that all of his children become professionals and he can increase his number of livestock.  His biggest challenge is natural disasters.

In his free time, he likes to play sports and his favorite custom is the dances that the community participates in.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: It has been a terribly hot season and, because of the drought, most of Edward's agricultural product did not do well this season save for cassava that is a bit resistant. He now needs a loan such that he can mulch some of his gardens to maintain the moisture and also buy drought-resistant seeds of maize and bananas. This, he thinks, will maintain his production regardless of the season. He is a hardworking and resilient man.

loans.use: To buy mulches and drought-resistant seeds

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 54-year-old married lady. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Mumtaz has accepted the fact that if only her husband works for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Mumtaz has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of her children’s bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 34-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of funds Suriya is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, age 18, is a married woman. She has been running a business selling eggs with her husband (also shown in the photo). He sells from his motorcycle to the people of their community and also supplies the local market. They earn a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of her business, Zahida applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees. She intends to use this loan to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity to inflate their sales. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of eggs in large quantity to inflate their sales.
